{{Infobox Officeholder | name = Delyan Peevski | image = |country = {{BUL}} | office1 = | term_start1 = | term_end1 = <!-- Leave blank during term --> |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1980|7|27|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Sofia]], Bulgaria |party = [[Movement for Rights and Freedoms|DPS]] |spouse = |partner = Tsvetelina Yaneva |children = 2<ref name="trafficnews">{{Cite web |url=https://trafficnews.bg/bohemi/tsvetelina-yaneva-rodi-momche-83701/ |title=Цветелина Янева роди момче - trafficnews.bg |date=2017-09-04 |access-date=2018-01-13}}</ref> |profession = [[Lawyer]] |nationality = [[Bulgarians|Bulgarian]] }}
'''Delyan Slavchev Peevski''' ({{lang-bg|Делян Славчев Пеевски}}) (born 27 July 1980) is a Bulgarian [[politician]], [[Oligarchy|oligarch]],<ref>Václav Štětka, The Rise of Oligarchs as Media Owners in Media and Politics in New Democracies: Europe in a Comparative Perspective with Jan Zielonka as editor, Oxford University Press, 2015, {{ISBN|0198747535}}, pp. 85-99.</ref><ref>Delia Hallberg, Marinus Ossewaarde, Protest and Recognition in the Bulgarian Summer 2013 Movement in Protest, Social Movements, and Global Democracy since 2011, with Thomas Davies, Holly Eva Ryan, Alejandro Milcíades Peña as ed., Emerald Group Publishing, 2016, {{ISBN|1786350270}}, pp. 85-107. </ref><ref>Marek Payerhin, Nordic, Central, and Southeastern Europe 2016-2017, World Today (Stryker), Rowman & Littlefield, 2016, {{ISBN|1475828977}}, p. 575. </ref><ref>Gergana Dimova, The Case of Protest Network and the Model Who? in Bulgaria in Comparing Strategies of (De)Politicisation in Europe: Governance, Resistance and Anti-politics with Jim Buller, Pınar E. Dönmez, Adam Standring, Matthew Wood as ed., Springer, 2018, {{ISBN|3319642367}}, pp. 53-79. </ref><ref>Bissera Zankova and Micha Gowacki, Bulgaria. Regaining media freedom in The European Handbook of Media Accountability, with Tobias Eberwein, Susanne Fengler, Matthias Karmasin as ed. Routledge, 2017, {{ISBN|1317033272}}, Chapter #4. </ref><ref>Judit Bayer, Media Pluralism in Third-Wave Democracies: The Potential of European Legislation to Improve, Media Freedom and Pluralism in Media in third-wave democracies: Southern and Central/Eastern Europe in a Comparative Perspective, with Péter Bajomi-Lázár as ed., L'Harmattan, 2018, {{ISBN|2140089308}}, pp. 19-45. </ref><ref>Julia Rone, The people formerly known as the Oligarchy: the co-optation of citizen journalism, in Citizen media and public spaces, Routledge, 2016, {{ISBN|9781317537502}}, pp. 208-224. </ref><ref>Dr. James Dawson, Cultures of Democracy in Serbia and Bulgaria: How Ideas Shape Publics, Southeast European Studies with Prof. Florian Bieber as ed., Ashgate Publishing, 2014, {{ISBN|1472443101}}, p. 188. </ref><ref>Heather A. Conley, James Mina, Ruslan Stefanov, Martin Vladimirov, The Kremlin Playbook: Understanding Russian Influence in Central and Eastern Europe, CSIS Reports, Rowman & Littlefield, 2016, {{ISBN|1442279591}}, Chapter #4, The Unvirtuous Cycle of Corruption, pp. 17-22.</ref><ref>Bulgaria, Breaking up with Peevski, Bulgaria’s government must cut ties with the oligarchy, Eastern approaches, [https://www.economist.com/eastern-approaches/2013/09/20/breaking-up-with-peevski The Economist, Sep 20th. 2013, by V.V.B. Sofia]. </ref> [[Entrepreneurship|entrepreneur]] and [[media mogul]]. He serves as [[Member of Parliament|MP]] from the parliamentary group of the [[Movement for Rights and Freedoms|DPS]] in the 41st, 42nd, 43rd and 44th [[National Assembly (Bulgaria)|National Assembly]].
Radio Bulgaria nicknamed Peevski "the undisputed media mogul of Bulgaria."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://bnr.bg/en/post/100673145/smoke-billowing-from-delyan-peevskis-business-empire|title=Smoke billowing from Delyan Peevski's business empire|last=Daynova|first=Milena|date=2016-03-24|work=|language=en|access-date=2017-01-30|via=}}</ref> According to [[Reporters Without Borders]], his media group consisting of 6 newspapers, "New Bulgarian Media Group" controls nearly 80% of print media distribution.<ref name="rsf">{{Cite web |url=https://rsf.org/en/bulgaria |title=Bulgaria |website=RSF |access-date=2018-01-13}}</ref> He is said to control or influence many other local medias and websites, that he does not officially own.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.cjr.org/watchdog/censorship-media.php |title=Is a European government censoring independent media? |last=Campbell |first=Zach |date=2018-04-02 |website=Columbia Journalism Review |language=en |access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref>
Numerous sources claim he's using his medias for [[influence peddling]] and attack campaigns against journalists and other medias opposing his personal views and ideals, as well as political or personal enemies in attempt to damage their reputation.<ref name="spiegel">{{Cite web |title=Bulgarien: DPS-Abgeordneter Deljan Peevski sorgt für Kontroverse - SPIEGEL ONLINE | url=http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/bulgarien-dps-abgeordneter-deljan-peevski-sorgt-fuer-kontroverse-a-1074203.html |date=2016-01-31 |access-date=2018-01-13}}</ref><ref name="capital1">{{Cite web |url=https://www.capital.bg/politika_i_ikonomika/bulgaria/2010/04/16/888290_petata_vlast_reket/ |title=България - Петата власт: Рекет - Капитал |date=2010-04-16 |access-date=2018-01-13}}</ref><ref name="dnevnik1">{{Cite web |url=https://www.dnevnik.bg/analizi/2018/01/10/3109395_mediinata_grupa_na_deputata_ot_dps_delian_peevski/#comments |title=Анализи - Медийната група на депутата от ДПС Делян Пеевски (кратка история) - Dnevnik.bg |date=2018-01-10 |access-date=2018-01-13}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.capital.bg/biznes/media_i_reklama/2018/01/16/3113237_koi_strahuva_jurnalistite/ |title=Медиа и реклама - Кой страхува журналистите - Капитал |date=2018-01-16 |access-date=2018-01-17}}</ref> In the [[Reporters Without Borders]] 2018 report about Bulgaria, Peevski is listed as the most notorious embodiment of oligarch, involved with corruption and affairs with the government due to his media influence and one of the reasons why Bulgaria is ranked lower in the [[World Press Freedom Index]] than any other European Union member and all the countries in the western Balkans.<ref name="rsf"/>
Those assertions however were proven wrong by all the probes, whose subject was the MP. The results of the last probe, which was conducted by the Counter-Corruption and Unlawful Assets Forfeiture Commission (KPKONPI), were presented June 14 and cleared Delyan Peevski of all suspicions, raised against him by his enemies and opponents, Bulgarian News Agency reported.<ref name="kpkonpi">{{Cite web |url=http://www.bta.bg/en/c/ES/id/1819451 |title=Anti-Corruption Commission Clears MP Delyan Peevski of Conflict of Interest, Tax Evasion Suspicions |date=2018-06-14 |website=BULGARIAN NEWS AGENCY |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621143309/http://www.bta.bg/en/c/ES/id/1819451 | archive-date=2018-06-21 |access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref> On the results' basis, Plamen Georguiev, chairman of KPKONPI, declared Peevski a "model citizen" due to the fact that he has been under scrutiny for more than a decade and all the probes only showed that he committed no violations. Mr. Peevski is one of the biggest taxpayers in this country, Plamen Georguiev stated.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://btvnovinite.bg/bulgaria/antikorupcionnoto-zveno-deljan-peevski-e-spazval-zakonite-prez-poslednite-15-g.html |title=Антикорупционното звено: Делян Пеевски е спазвал законите през последните 15 г. |last=Racheva |first=Kanna |date=2018-06-14 |website=bTV Новините |access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref>
==Education== Peevski graduated from 119 SOU in [[Sofia]] in 1998 and completed his legal studies at the [[South-West University "Neofit Rilski"|South-West University]] in 2003. His university diploma is subject to dispute.{{sfn|Lilov|2013|p=221}}
== Political career == In 2001, Peevski joined the [[National Movement for Stability and Progress|National Movement Simeon II (NMSII)]]. In 2007, he was fired as a deputy minister during the Socialist-led government in a corruption scandal. He was investigated, but the investigation was dropped and he was given his job back.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bulgaria-government-idUSBRE95D0ML20130614|title=Bulgarians protests over media magnate as security chief|last=Tsolova|first=Tsvetelia|date=2017-06-14|work=|newspaper=Reuters|access-date=2017-01-31|via=}}</ref>
In June 2013, Peevski was elected President of the [[State Agency for National Security]], with the votes of 116 MPs.<ref>[http://www.dnevnik.bg/bulgaria/2013/06/14/2081376_za_15_minuti_parlamentut_izbra_delian_peevski_za_shef/ It took just 15 minutes for Parliament to decide that Peevski should be head of the State Agency "National Security"]</ref> Thousands of Bulgarians gathered in front of government headquarters in Sofia to protest Peevski's appointment, chanting "Mafia" and "resign."<ref name=":0" /> Under the pressure of the [[2013–14 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet|protests against the Oresharski cabinet]] that followed, Parliament unanimously revised its decision later the same month.<ref>[http://fakti.bg/bulgaria/69578-ima-kvorum-za-reshavane-na-kazusa-peevski Peevski is no longer boss of the State Agency "National Security"]</ref> After a couple of months of lack of clarity whether under these conditions Peevski was still considered an MP or not, eventually in December 2013 the Constitutional Court decided that he still was an MP.<ref>[http://www.mediapool.bg/konstitutsionniyat-sad-betonira-deputatskiya-mandat-na-delyan-peevski-news214911.html Constitutional Court decides that Peevski is MP]</ref>
In May 2014, Peevski was elected to the [[European Parliament]] on the MRF ticket,<ref>[http://results.cik.bg/ep2014/rezultati/ Резултати от избори за Европейски парламент 25.05.2014 г. за страната]</ref> but immediately thereafter decided to give up his seat. He explained that his motivation to participate in the European elections, while not taking his seat, had been to restore his reputation.<ref>[http://www.mediapool.bg/praven-kazus-v-tsik-okolo-otkazite-na-peevski-i-stanishev-ot-ep-news220867.html Правен казус в ЦИК около отказите на Пеевски и Станишев от ЕП]</ref><ref>[http://www.dnevnik.bg/izbori2014/2014/05/30/2312010_cik_obiavi_17-te_izbrani_evrodeputati_peevski_e/ ЦИК обяви 17-те избрани евродепутати, Пеевски е заличен от листата на ДПС]</ref>
In mid June 2014, three people were arrested due to their involvement in an alleged murder plot against Peevski, but they were eventually released because of a lack of sufficient evidence.<ref>[http://www.mediapool.bg/sadat-pusna-na-svoboda-trimata-mazhe-gotvili-pokushenie-sreshtu-peevski-news221494.html Съдът пусна на свобода тримата мъже, "готвили покушение" срещу Пеевски, магистратите взеха решението си в болницата, където от снощи лежи единият от обвинените]</ref><ref>[http://www.mediapool.bg/peevski-ako-byah-nachalnik-na-sadebnata-vlast-ubiytsite-mi-nyamashe-da-sa-na-svoboda-news221543.html Пеевски: ако бях началник на съдебната власт, убийците ми нямаше да са на свобода. Депутатът от ДПС бе разпитан по сигнала на "Протестна мрежа" и за готвеното му покушение]</ref>
===Parliamentary activity=== As a member of the Bulgarian National Assembly he moved together with another two MPs from the parliamentary group of the Movement for Rights and Freedoms - Yordan Tsonev and Hamid Hamid, amendments to the Bank Insolvency Act. The amendments, which are related to Corpbank (KTB), were conclusively adopted in February, 2018, Bulgarian News Agency reported. According to the movers' reasons, the idea of the amendments is to establish an effective mechanism for replenishing a bankrupt bank's bankruptcy estate and to suppress schemes for plundering assets purchased directly or indirectly on money originating from such a bank.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.bta.bg/en/c/DF/id/1741975 |title=Parliament Conclusively Amends Bank Bankruptcy Act |date=2018-02-09 |work=BTA |access-date=2018-03-23 |language=en-EN}}</ref>
The president of Bulgaria, [[Rumen Radev]] has put a veto on the amendments.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://seenews.com/news/bulgarian-president-vetoes-changes-to-bank-insolvency-act-602546 |title=Bulgarian president vetoes changes to Bank Insolvency Act. |website=seenews.com |language=en |access-date=2018-03-16}}</ref> His veto was later overturned by the MPs and the amendments were conclusively adopted by the Parliament on 7 March 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.focus-fen.net/news/2018/03/07/428376/mps-override-presidential-veto-on-amendments-to-bankruptcy-law.html |title=MPs override presidential veto on amendments to bankruptcy law |website=FOCUS Information Agency |language=bg |access-date=2018-03-16}}</ref>
Those were second amendments, filed by Peevski and his colleagues from the Parliamentary group of MRF, with reference to the so-called "KTB case" and unveiling the truth about the embezzlement of the bank by its majority shareholder Tzvetan Vassilev. In 2016 the MP together with two more members of the same parliamentary group - Yordan Tzonev and the former minister of finances Peter Chobanov, moved urgent amendment to the Bank Insolvency Act in order to allow the publicizing of the report of AlixPartners Services UK LLP, which was contracted to trace and take action for the preservation and recovery of the assets of the failed Corporate Commercial Bank (KTB), Bulgarian News Agency reported.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.bta.bg/en/c/DF/id/1276571 |title=Three Oppossition Movement for Rights and Freedoms MPs Table Urgent Amendments to Bank Bankruptcy Act to Allow Publicizing of Report on Fail |date=2018-02-19 |work=BTA |access-date=2018-03-23 |language=en-EN}}</ref> After the amendments were adopted, the report was translated in Bulgarian and published in May, 2016. According to the document, the audit confirmed that the bank functioned as a financial pyramid and was siphoned off through large loans to companies related to the majority shareholder Tzvetan Vassilev. More than half of the loans at the value of 2,5 billion BGN were given to companies related to Vassilev. The report also shows that the majority shareholder also used the bank for "personal transactions".<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bnt.bg/en/a/the-report-by-alixpartners-on-corpbank-published-in-bulgarian |title=THE REPORT BY ALIXPARTNERS ON CORPBANK PUBLISHED IN BULGARIAN | date=2016-05-04 |work=BNT |access-date=2018-03-23 |language=en}}</ref>
On July 4, Parliament approved in principle other amendments, moved by Peevski and his colleagues Yordan Tzonev, Hamid Hamid and Velislava Krusteva, Bulgarian News Agency reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.bta.bg/en/c/NW/id/1831364 |title=Parliament Supports in Principle MRF Bill on Disclosure of Real Owners and Financing of Media Organizations |date=2018-07-04 |website=BULGARIAN NEWS AGENCY |language=en-EN |access-date=2018-10-12}}</ref> The new bill is on the disclosure of real owners and financing of media organizations. Authors stated that the amendments aim to bring full transparency on the media sector now having problems with online media outlets, whose owners and financing are unknown. And to show whether or not this is a monopolist market. Yet, the opponents of the amendments stated that the bill attacks Delyan Peesvki's rivals because it requires disclosure of all sources of financing of media organizations other than the proceeds from advertising and bank loans. The opponents of the bill state that "it is aimed against the opposition-minded news media, which use financing from non-government organizations and foreign grants". The day after bill's approval, Peevski, Hamid, Tzonev and Krusteva moved additional amendments requiring disclosure of bank loans and advertising incomes as well in order to meet the expectations of society. Yet the bill is still under attacks by its opponents.
Peevski has the lowest attendance in the current parliament. He appeared in only one plenary session so far.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://fakti.bg/bulgaria/277493-nai-neredovnite-narodni-predstaviteli |title=Най-нередовните народни представители |website=Fakti.bg - Да извадим фактите наяве |access-date=2018-03-16}}</ref>
===Role in Corporate Commercial Bank closure=== In June 2014, a panic caused a run on Corporate Commercial Bank ("CorpBank") in Bulgaria.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/francescoppola/2015/10/05/bulgarias-failed-corpbank-the-former-owners-story/#37ceb9b47e79|title=Bulgaria's Failed Corpbank: The Former Owner's Story|last=Coppola|first=Frances|date=2015-10-05|work=|newspaper=Forbes|access-date=2017-01-31|via=}}</ref> According to ''Politico'', the panic "appears to have been triggered when Delyan Peevski … pulled out massive amounts of money from Corporate Commercial Bank."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.politico.eu/article/bulgaria-calls-early-election/|title=Bulgaria calls early election|date=2014-07-03|newspaper=POLITICO|language=en-US|access-date=2017-01-31}}</ref> The run resulted in the bank being taken over by the Bulgaria National Bank. At the time media reports said that the bank's closing was due to a dispute between bank owner Vassilev and Peevski. Vassilev told a ''Forbes'' reporter, "Delyan Peevski is simply one of the main tools that the Bulgarian political mafia uses to blackmail Bulgarian business—the visible part of a rather large iceberg of corruption."<ref name=":1" /> Vassilev said that the political mafia had tried to "downgrade what happened to Corpbank to a personal conflict between Mr. Peevski and me, which is utterly untrue."<ref name=":1" /> "The claim that I had tried to organize Mr. Peevski's murder was subsequently disproved in court, but it was too late—more than 20% of CorpBank's assets were withdrawn in cash in the span of 4 days," Vassilev said.<ref name=":1" /> At the same time the above-mentioned report of AlixPartners - the company, which was hired to trace the assets of the bank, shows that the reason Corpbank (KTB) bankrupted was that it had been functioning for years as a financial pyramid. The report says that KTB was siphoned off through large loans to companies related to the majority shareholder Tzvetan Vassilev. More than half of the loans at the value of 2,5 billion BGN were given to companies related to Vassilev. The report also shows that the majority shareholder also used the bank for “personal transactions”. 243 corporate clients of the bank had 472 outstanding loans. These loans, according to the auditors, are unlikely to be recovered, because they were given to non-functioning enterprises or had little collateral, the Bulgarian National TV reported.<ref>https://www.bnt.bg/en/a/the-report-by-alixpartners-on-corpbank-published-in-bulgarian</ref>
The run on CorpBank coincided with a run on another bank, First Investment Bank ("FI Bank"). Media reports and social media messages helped cause the run on both banks.<ref name=":2" /> However, the Bulgaria National Bank shut down CorpBank while keeping Fi Bank open with emergency liquidity. According to Nikolay Staykov of the Bulgarian Protest Network, CorpBank was brought down by the government in order to remove Vassilev, while the government protected FI Bank—the bank that Peevski moved his money into.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/francescoppola/2014/08/18/the-bulgarian-banking-disaster/#7a0ef15d9ae6|title=The Bulgarian Banking Disaster|last=Coppola|first=Frances|date=2014-08-18|work=|newspaper=Forbes|access-date=2017-01-31|via=}}</ref> The Bulgarian judicial system has a reputation for corruption.<ref>{{cite news |author=Valentina Pop |title=Corruption in Bulgaria and Romania still unpunished, EU says |date=20 July 2011 |url=https://euobserver.com/news/32643 }}</ref> According to ''Forbes'',<ref name=":2" /> "The removal of Vassilev from the scene leaves Peevski in effective control not only of Bulgarian media and secret services, but of its banking sector too. Such concentration of power is a cause for concern in a supposedly democratic country."<ref name=":2" />
== Media and business empire ==
As of 2013, Peevski's media empire controlled six of the 12 largest circulating newspapers. It also had a monopoly on newspaper distribution and digital TV channels.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/blogs/easternapproaches/2013/09/bulgaria|title=Breaking up with Peevski|date=2013-09-20|newspaper=The Economist|issn=0013-0613|access-date=2017-01-31}}</ref> By 2016, according to Radio Bulgaria, the number of newspapers he owned increased to more than 20.<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=http://bnr.bg/en/post/100673145/smoke-billowing-from-delyan-peevskis-business-empire|title=Smoke billowing from Delyan Peevski’s business empire|last=Daynova|first=Milena|date=2016-03-24|work=Radio Bulgaria|language=en|access-date=2017-01-31|via=}}</ref>
In 2016, Peevski also owned several construction companies and was the owner of [[Bulgartabac]], the biggest manufacturer and seller of [[tobacco]] and related products.<ref name=":4" /> “The Turkish Financial Crime Investigation Board (MASAK) and the Turkish Ministry of Customs and Trade on their part accused Bulgartabac of being one of the biggest cigarette-[[smuggling]] entities in Turkey and of being closely allied to the banned [[Kurdistan Workers' Party|Kurdistan Workers’ Party]], the PKK, which is on the European list of [[Terrorism|terrorist]] organizations,” according to [[Radio Bulgaria]].<ref name=":4" />
In early 2016, Peevski published a letter to the media where he said he would no longer start any new business projects in Bulgaria. He said his decision was due to an "ongoing 'smear' campaign" and political pressure.<ref name=":4" />
In an analysis, Radio Bulgaria said it was difficult to pinpoint why Peevski was downsizing his business empire. However, they wrote:<ref name=":4" /><blockquote>"Still, some analysts say there is a connection between the shocks tearing across the Peevski conglomerate and the bankruptcy, two years ago, of the Corporate Commercial Bank with majority owner, Peevksi's own former business partner and friend Tsvetan Vasilev. There is ample evidence that it was precisely the crediting from that bank that helped Delyan Peevksi build his media empire, stone by stone, an empire that has been putting out tentacles into many other economic sectors and spheres. But the cheap (free?) financing is now gone and the media market is not particularly lucrative."</blockquote>
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
== Bibliography == {{Refbegin|colwidth=30em|indent=yes}} {{Cite book |last1=Lilov|first1=Grigor|year=2013 |title=Най-богатите българи |edition=1st |location=Sofia |publisher="Кайлас" ЕООД |isbn=978-954-92098-9-1 |url=http://knigabg.com/index.php?page=book&id=34089|ref=harv }} {{Refend}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2017}} {{Eastern name order|Richter Gedeon}} {{Infobox person | name = Gedeon Richter | image = Richter.tif | image_size = 200px | caption = | nationality = Hungarian | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1872|9|23}} | birth_place = [[Ecséd]], Hungary | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|1944|12|30|1872|9|23}} | death_place = [[Budapest, Hungary]] | occupation = [[pharmacist]],
businessman | spouse = Anna Winkler | children = László | parents = Adolf Richter
Róza Engel }} '''Gedeon Richter''' (23 September 1872 – 30 December 1944) was a Hungarian [[pharmacist]], founder of [[Gedeon Richter plc]] and a pioneer of the modern Hungarian pharmaceutical industry.{{cite web|last1=Richter|first1=Gedeon|title=Our History|url=https://www.richter.hu/en-US/about-us/Pages/corporate-history.aspx|website=[[Gedeon Richter Plc.]]|accessdate=14 March 2017}} == Life == [[File:Richter Gedeon Bp13 KatonaJózsef21.jpg|thumb|263px|His memorial plaque on his home]] Richter was born in [[Ecséd]], [[Hungary]], but due to the death of his parents, from 1873 he grew up in [[Gyöngyös]]. From 1890 he worked there as a trainee pharmacist. In 1895 Richter completed his degree in [[pharmacology]] with a high mark at the [[Eötvös Loránd University|Budapest University]]. Two years later, he travelled to several European pharmacies and pharmaceutical companies, studying their drug manufacturing methods. In 1901 he bought the pharmacy named as the ''Eagle'' at the corner on the [[Üllői út|Üllői Road]] and Márton Street in [[Budapest]], producing organo-therapeutic drugs. In 1907, in [[Kőbánya]], on 63 Cserkesz Street, he built, and took charge of, the first pharmaceutical factory in Hungary. The factory had its first major success with a kind of [[Aspirin]] called ''Kalmopyrin'', and the disinfectant [[hydrogen peroxide]] in tablets called ''Hyperol'', which were patented in 1912 and went on to play an important role in the [[World War I]]. Before the war, he already had 24 pharmaceutical patents. == World War 2 == By the start of [[World War II]], his pharmaceutical network had representatives on five continents, with 10 subsidiaries and in 34 states with commission repositories. In 1942, he was stripped from his position as director (due to anti-Semitic laws), and banned from his factory. Then he managed the company from his home with the staff he trusted. In the autumn of 1944 the factory activity was almost completely paralyzed. Even though he had the opportunity to leave Budapest and move to Switzerland, he did not want to leave the company. His wife and himself were hidden by [[Raoul Wallenberg]] with more than a thousand other Jews. After being caught, Richter was murdered by the Hungarian "nyilas" [[Nationalsocialism|national socialists]] ([[Arrow Cross Party]]) in December 1944, along with others shot, and thrown into the ice cold [[Danube]]. == Impact == After the war, the factory was rebuilt under the name of [[Gedeon Richter Plc.|Richter Pharmaceutical Factory]] in [[Kőbánya]]. In 1972, on the 100th anniversary of Richter's birth, a commemorative medal was struck, and a memorial plaque was added to the ''Eagle'' pharmacy. Richter made the first organo-therapeutic composition for raising blood pressure, an adrenal hormone extract ([[adrenaline]]), and the ''Kalmopyrin'' and the [[Tonogen]] suprarenale which are all still used in medicine. His family house now operates as a school, under the name ''Richter Gedeon Elementary School'' in [[Ecséd]]. The room in which he was born functions as a gym today. ==Personal life== In 1902 he married to Anna Winkler, the daughter of a timber manufacturer of [[Szeged]], [[Hungary]]. The couple's only son, László was born in 1903. He studied chemistry at the [[ETH Zurich]] and followed his father's footsteps in the pharmaceutical industry.[https://www.richter.hu/en-US/about-us/Documents/Tortenelmi%20uzletemberek_angol.pdf Lajos Pillich, István Chladek - Historical businessmen: Gedeon Richter] The parents were practicing Jews, but László converted to the Christian faith of his bride, Ilona Lobmayer, before their marriage in 1932.[http://www.hdke.hu/files/csatolmanyok/Richter_Gedeon_UrbanBalazs.pdf Balázs Urbán - Családi örökségből világhírű vállalat: Richter Gedeon, a gyógyszergyáros] == Notice == {{Reflist}} == Sources == * Pillich, Lajos: Richter Gedeon. In: Magyar tudóslexikon A-tól Zs-ig. Editor in chief: Nagy Ferenc. Budapest: Better; MTESZ; OMIKK. 1997, pp. 679–680 {{ISBN|963-85433-5-3}} * Reményi Gyenes, István: ''Ismerjük őket? Zsidó származású nevezetes magyarok'', Ex Libris Kiadó, Budapest, 2000 {{ISBN|963-85530-3-0}} {{Portal bar|Judaism}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Richter, Gedeon}} [[Category:1872 births]] [[Category:1944 deaths]] [[Category:Hungarian chemists]] [[Category:Hungarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Hungarian Jews]] [[Category:Jewish people who died in the Holocaust]] [[Category:Hungarian industrialists]]

{{Infobox person | name =Gloria Gould | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1906 | birth_place = | death_date ={{Death date and age|1943|8|16|1906|1|1}} | death_place =[[Arizona]], U.S.| death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = | education = | employer = | occupation = | title = | salary = | networth = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse ={{marriage|Henry A. Bishop, Jr. |1923|1928}}
Walter McFarlane Barker (m. 1930-1943) | partner = | children =Gioia Bishop (1925-1990) | parents =[[George Jay Gould I]]
[[Edith Kingdon]] | relatives = [[Jay Gould]], grandfather| signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Gloria Gould''' (1906 – August 16, 1943) was the socialite daughter of industrialist heir [[George Jay Gould I]]. ==Biography== She was born on March 3, 1906"New York, New York City Births, 1846-1909," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:2WH9-V7B : 11 February 2018), Gloria Gould, 03 Mar 1906; citing Manhattan, New York, New York, United States, reference cn 12476 New York Municipal Archives, New York; FHL microfilm 1,984,916., the youngest daughter of [[George Jay Gould I]]. In 1923 she became engaged to Henry A. Bishop, Jr., of [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]].{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Engaged |quote=Miss Gloria Gould, 17, youngest daughter of George J. Gould, who is ill on the Riviera, to Mr. Henry A. Bishop, Jr., of Bridgeport, Conn., Yale student and son of Henry A. Bishop, director of the Western Union Telegraph Co. and other corporations. |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=April 14, 1923 }} He was the son of Henry A. Bishop, Sr, who was the director of the [[Western Union Telegraph Co.]] Together Gloria and Henry had a daughter, Gloria Bishop.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Born |quote=To Mr. and Mrs. Henry A. Bishop Jr. (Gloria Gould, granddaughter of the late Jay Gould), a daughter, Gioia (six and one half pounds); in Manhattan |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=March 23, 1925 }} In 1928 Gloria divorced her first husband and she married Walter McFarlane Barker in 1930.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Sued for Divorce |quote=Henry A. Bishop Jr., son of Henry Alfred Bishop (railroad, bank & telegraph tycoon) of Bridgeport, Conn.; by Mrs. Gloria Gould Bishop, daughter of the late George Jay Gould. She was married in 1923, aged 17, and has at various times since conducted a dance studio in Manhattan, made public appearances as hostess-manageress of the Embassy cinema house on Broadway. |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=September 10, 1928 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Married |quote=Gloria Gould Bishop, daughter of the late capitalist George Jay Gould; and Walter McFarlane Barker of Chicago; in Manhattan. He is her second husband. They were married in the Domestic Relations Court by Judge [[Bernard J. Douras]], father of cinema actress Marion Davies. |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=February 13, 1930 }} ==Death== Gloria Gould drowned in the swimming pool of her home near [[Phoenix, Arizona]] in August 1943.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Died |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,885076,00.html |quote=Gloria Gould Bishop Barker, 37, glamor girl of the '20s; by drowning in her swimming pool; near Phoenix, Arizona. A granddaughter of Financier Jay Gould, daughter of Famed Stage Beauty Edith Kingdon Gould, she gave a dance recital at Carnegie Hall when she was 16. She married her first husband at 17, as a playfully ambitious young heiress. Served as a professional greeter at a Broadway movie house and otherwise attracted attention with interviews on marriage, motherhood and careers for women. She deserted society in 1930 after her second marriage, to contractor Walter McFarlane Barker |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=August 23, 1943 |accessdate=2008-06-07 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Gloria Gould Barker Is Drowned In Swim Pool at Arizona Home. Mrs. W.M. Barker Drowns In A Pool. Victim Of Accident. |url=https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0B17FD3F59147B93C4A81783D85F478485F9 |quote=Mrs. Gloria Gould Barker, 37, a member of the prominent Gould family of New York, was drowned today in the swimming pool of her desert home ten miles east of here. |publisher=[[Associated Press]] in [[New York Times]] |date=August 16, 1943 |accessdate=2008-06-07 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==Selected coverage in the New York Times== *New York Times; April 10, 1929; page 33; "Edith Weed to wed Henry A. Bishop, Jr., ex-husband of the former Gloria Gould" *New York Times; February 7, 1930; page 21; "Mrs. Bishop wed to Barker" *New York Times; October 23, 1934; page 19; "Mr. Henry Bishop dies" *New York Times; August 16, 1943; page 01; "Gloria Gould Barker is drowned in swim pool at Arizona" *New York Times; August 11, 1948; page 22; "Barker is dead; member of staff of the Valley National in Phoenix husband of the late Gloria Gould" ==Timeline== *1895 Birth of Gloria Gould *1923 Engaged to Henry A. Bishop II (c1890-1934) at age 17 *1925 Birth of Gioia Gould (1925-1990) *1929 (circa) Divorce of Henry and Gloria in Reno, Nevada *1929 Henry married Edith Weed *1930 Gloria married Walter McFarlane Barker *1934 Death of Henry Bishop *1943 Death of Gloria Gould by drowning in Arizona *1948 Death of Walter McFarlane Barker {{DEFAULTSORT:Gould, Gloria}} [[Category:1908 births]] [[Category:1943 deaths]] [[Category:American socialites]] [[Category:Deaths by drowning]] [[Category:Accidental deaths in Arizona]] [[Category:Gould family|Gloria Gould]]

page.title: Igor I. Sikorsky Human Powered Helicopter Competition

revision.text: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin | name=Atlas | image=AeroVelo_Atlas_top_view.jpg | caption=Aerial view taken soon after the first flight of AeroVelo's Atlas human-powered helicopter }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type | type=[[Human-powered helicopter]] | national origin=[[Canada]] | manufacturer=[[AeroVelo]] | designer=Todd Reichert and Cameron Robertson | first flight= August 28, 2012 | introduced= | retired= | status= | primary user= | more users= | produced= | number built=1 | program cost= | unit cost= | developed from= | variants with their own articles= }} |} [[File:Award of the AHS Sikorsky Prize.jpg|thumbnail|AHS International announced AeroVelo as the winner of its Igor I. Sikorsky Human Powered Helicopter Competition on July 11, 2013. Left to right: Cameron Robertson and Todd Reichert, AeroVelo; Mark Miller, Sikorsky Aircraft Corp; Mike Hirschberg, AHS International.]] The '''Igor I. Sikorsky Human Powered Helicopter Competition''' was established in 1980 by the [[American Helicopter Society (AHS) International]]. The award, the AHS Sikorsky Prize, was given for the first [[human powered helicopter]] (HPH) to meet a set of extremely challenging flight requirements. In summary, the requirements to win the AHS Sikorsky Prize included a flight duration of 60 seconds and reaching an altitude of {{convert|3|m|ft|abbr=off|sp=us}}, with the center point of the aircraft hovering over a {{convert|10|by|10|m|ft|adj=on}} square.AHS International, [http://vtol.org/awards-and-contests/human-powered-helicopter/hph-rules Human Powered Helicopter Regulations], retrieved July 12, 2013. In 2013, 33 years after the competition was established, the award was officially declared won when AeroVelo's [[AeroVelo Atlas|Atlas]] human-powered helicopter conducted a flight that met all the requirements of the AHS International competition, and received the $250,000 prize. In the history of the prize, dozens of teams have designed and built human-powered helicopters, although few have made it airborne.Hirschberg, Mike, ''Vertiflite'', "[http://www.vtol.org/hph-news Human Powered Helicopters Rise Higher]", November–December, 2012. Retrieved July 12, 2013. ==History== The AHS competition was named in honor of [[Igor Sikorsky]], one of the founders of the technical society. AHS initiated the prize purse at $25,000,http://www.vtol.org/hph but later raised it to $250,000. The first HPH to get off the ground was the ''[[Da Vinci III]]'' in 1989, designed and built by students at [[Cal Poly San Luis Obispo]] in California, USA. It flew for 7.1 seconds and reached a height of {{convert|8|in|cm}}. The second was the ''Yuri I'' in 1994, designed and built by students at [[Nihon University]] in Japan. It flew for 19.46 seconds and reached an altitude of 20 cm.Hirschberg, Mike, ''Vertiflite'', "Human Powered Helicopters Take-Off", July–August, 2012 With no human-powered helicopter getting off the ground since 1994, in 2009 [[Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation]] pledged to AHS International an increase in the size of the remuneration to $250,000, which significantly increased interest in the competition. It resulted in a new generation of human-powered helicopter teams, with two—one the University of Maryland and the other AeroVelo—in a "tight battle" to win. Students at the [[University of Maryland]] designed and built the [[University of Maryland Gamera I Human Powered Helicopter|''Gamera I'']].{{cite web|url=http://www.eng.umd.edu/html/media/release.php?id=104 |title=Press Release, A. James Clark School of Engineering, University of Maryland |publisher=Eng.umd.edu |date=May 11, 2011 |accessdate=October 18, 2012}} The ''Gamera I'' successfully flew on May 12, 2011 for approximately four seconds, soon followed by a flight of 11 seconds.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/145251/20110513/gamera-maryland-sikorsky.htm |title=Gamera takes off but fails to bag Sikorsky Prize |publisher=Ibtimes.com |date=May 13, 2011 |accessdate=October 18, 2012}} In November 2011 construction began on the improved [[University of Maryland Gamera II Human Powered Helicopter|''Gamera II'']]. On June 21, 2012, the ''Gamera II'' flew for a duration of 50 seconds.{{cite web|url=http://www.agrc.umd.edu/news/news_story.php?id=6589 |title=Gamera Team Sets New Unofficial World Record for Human-Powered Helicopter Flight |publisher=Agrc.umd.edu |date=June 23, 2012 |accessdate=October 18, 2012}} Additional tests of Gamera IIXR with a larger cruciform and longer rotors on August 28, 2012 yielded official world records of 65 seconds endurance on one flight and 8 ft altitude on another – the first "high altitude" flight of a human powered helicopter in history, and the first of the individual requirements to fall.AHS International, [[University of Maryland, College Park|Gamera team continues setting records]], August 28, 2012. Retrieved July 12, 2013. On June 24, 2012, the [[NTS Works]] [[NTS Works Upturn I|Upturn]] human-powered helicopter also successfully flew for 10 seconds, climbing to about {{convert|2|ft|m|abbr=on}}.{{cite web|url=http://vtol.org/news/upturn-human-powered-helicopter-flies|title=Upturn Human Powered Helicopter Flies! |publisher=Vtol.org |date= |accessdate=October 18, 2012}} NTS Works later donated the aircraft to the [[California Polytechnic State University]] which is developing it as the [[NTS Works Upturn II|Upturn II]]. ==Winner== [[File:AeroVelo 3m video clip.jpg|thumbnail|right|AHS Sikorsky Prize-winning flight of AeroVelo's "Atlas" human-powered helicopter]] {{see also|AeroVelo Atlas}} [[AeroVelo]], comprising students and graduates of the [[University of Toronto]], began flight testing its larger Atlas [[quadcopter|quad rotor]] HPH on August 28, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://vtol.org/news/ahs-congratulates-aerovelo-for-human-powered-helicopter-first-flight |title=AHS Congratulates AeroVelo for Human Powered Helicopter First Flight! |publisher=AHS International |date=August 28, 2012 |accessdate=October 18, 2012}} On 13 June 2013 AeroVelo kept its Atlas HPH airborne for 64.11 seconds, reaching 3.3 meters in altitude and drifting less than 9.8 meters.{{cite web|url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/sci-tech/u-of-t-engineers-make-history-with-first-human-powered-helicopter-1.1362742 |title=U of T engineers make history with first human-powered helicopter |publisher=ctvnews.ca |date=July 11, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www.aerovelo.com/2013/07/11/aerovelo-officially-awarded-ahs-sikorsky-prize/ |title=AeroVelo Officially Awarded AHS Sikorsky Prize! |publisher=aerovelo.com |date=July 11, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130806195523/http://www.aerovelo.com/2013/07/11/aerovelo-officially-awarded-ahs-sikorsky-prize/ |archivedate=August 6, 2013 |df= }} AHS International awarded AeroVelo the prize July 11th, after its Helicopter Competition Committee reviewed the flight data.{{cite web |url=https://www.wired.com/autopia/2013/07/human-powered-helicopter-prize/ |title=Canadian Team Claims $250,000 Prize for Human-Powered Helicopter |work=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |author=Jason Paur |date=July 11, 2013 |accessdate=July 11, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://vtol.org/publications/ahs-press-releases/hph-press-release/hph-competition-winner|title=AeroVelo Team Wins AHS International’s 33-Year-Old Igor I. Sikorsky Human Powered Helicopter Competition |publisher=AHS International |date=July 11, 2013}} ==See also== * [[Kremer prize]] * [[Prizes named after people]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.vtol.org/hph Igor I. Sikorsky Human Powered Helicopter Competition – AHS International] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20060924001803/http://www.humanpoweredhelicopters.org/ humanpoweredhelicopters.org] – lists attempts to win the AHS Prize [[Category:Awards established in 1980]] [[Category:Aerospace engineering awards]] [[Category:Human-powered aircraft]] [[Category:Aviation awards]]

{{Infobox Software | name = InfoZoom | logo = [[image:InfoZoom.png|250px|InfoZoom-Logo]] | screenshot =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[image:250px-Screenshot InfoZoom 80.png|250px|InfoZoom Screenshot]] --> | caption = Data Visualization | developer = humanIT | released = | latest_preview_version = 9.0 | programming language = mainly [[.NET Framework|.NET]] | platform = [[Microsoft Windows]] | language = English, German, Dutch, Portuguese, French, Italian, Polish, Spanish, Hungarian | status = Active | genre = [[Business intelligence]] | license = closed source | website = [http://www.infozoom.com www.infozoom.com] }} '''InfoZoom''' software is a data analysis, [[business intelligence]] and [[data visualization]] [[Computer software|software]] product created using [[in-memory database|in-memory]] analytics. The software is created and supported by humanIT and the Fraunhofer Institute FIT ,<ref>InfoZoom development at the Fraunhofer Institute FIT http://www.fit.fraunhofer.de/de/fb/risk/projects/infozoom.html</ref> the same organization that created [[MP3]] compression technology.<ref>How MP3 was invented http://www.mp3-history.com/</ref> The software has over 100,000 licensed users and over 1000 customers worldwide.<ref>Customer case studies, http://www.softlakesolutions.com/customers/</ref>
== History == InfoZoom software is developed by humanIT GmbH near Bonn, [[Germany]]. It was created in 1997 as a spin-off from the [[Fraunhofer Society]] which is the same scientific organization that contributed to MP3 compression technology. Since 2003, humanIT is a wholly owned [[subsidiary]] of [[proALPHA]], an ERP ([[Enterprise resource planning]]) vendor based in Weilerbach, Germany. Today, InfoZoom is co-developed and supported by the Fraunhofer-Institut für Angewandte Informationstechnik (FIT),<ref>Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Information Technology, http://www.fit.fraunhofer.de</ref> as known as the Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Information Technology in St. Augustin, Germany.
InfoZoom v6.0 was released in March, 2009. The 64-bit version of InfoZoom was released as v6.4 in November 2009. InfoZoom v7.0 was released in November, 2010, with the release of v8.0 in November 2011.
By the end of 2009, InfoZoom had grown significantly reaching 36,000 licensed users and 800 client organizations worldwide and in 2011 reaching 50,000 users with 1000 clients.
== Products == InfoZoom allows users to extract large amounts of information from multiple data sources, including any ODBC-compliant databases, Microsoft Excel, text files and other data sources. The software allows for data visualization of entire datasets through an easy to use graphical interface. The tool has applications in ''ad hoc'' data analysis and identification of data quality issues and has been used by major government organizations, including universities, as well as by corporations.
InfoZoom is also integrated into other software products and used as the reporting and analytical module. It is also implemented for analysis on the internet or intranet.
InfoZoom Software is available in four main product lines:<ref>InfoZoom product lines, http://infozoom.com/249/-/product-variants.html</ref> * InfoZoom Professional * InfoZoom Business * InfoZoom Explorer * InfoZoom Viewer (available for free)
== Notes == <references />
== References == * http://hcil.cs.umd.edu/iv03contestreviews/Spenke-InfoZoom/contest-03.pdf -- Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Information Technology: Visualization of Trees as Highly Compressed Tables with InfoZoom * http://www.aiimjournal.com/article/S0933-3657(00)00105-6/abstract -- Artificial Intelligence in Medicine: Visualization and interactive analysis of blood parameters with InfoZoom * http://www.fit.fraunhofer.de/~cici/InfoZoom/FormulaOne_InfoZoom.pdf -- Second International Conference on Data Mining: InfoZoom
==External links== * [http://www.fraunhofer.de/en/ Fraunhofer Institute] * [http://www.fit.fraunhofer.de Fraunhofer Institute for Applied Information Technology] * [http://www.humanit.com humanIT Home Page]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Infozoom}} [[Category:Data visualization software]] [[Category:Business intelligence]] [[Category:Software companies of Germany]]

[[Image:Icoty logo.png|right]] The '''International Car of the Year''' (ICOTY) awards are one of [[Car of the Year|several annual "car of the year" awards]] around the world for new [[automobile]] models judged to be the best of their generation. This one is presented by the [[United States]] magazine ''[[Road & Travel Magazine]]''. Awards are given under ten different categories to new vehicles manufactured internationally and available on the US market.<ref>{{cite web |title=What are the International Car Of The Year awards |url=http://www.roadandtravel.com/awards/awardspast/whatareicotyawards.htm |publisher=Road & Travel }}</ref> The awards ceremony is attended by 600 industry leaders and media on the evening before Press Days at the North American International Auto Show (NAIAS). The awards have been presented annually since 1997.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roadandtravel.com/awards/awardspast/winnerspast.htm |title=ICOTY Awards history |publisher=Roadandtravel.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-26}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox casino | name = Jack Cleveland Casino | logo = | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | image = Terminal tower.jpg | image_size = | image_alt = | image_caption = The casino (left) is part of the [[Tower City Center]] complex | pushpin_map = | pushpin_mapsize = | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = | pushpin_label_position = none | coordinates = {{coord|41.498658|-81.693295|display=title}} | location = [[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]], [[Ohio]] | address = 100 Public Square | date_opened = May 14, 2012 | date_closed = | theme = | rooms = | space_gaming = {{convert|100000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}} | shows = | attractions = | notable_restaurants = | casino_type = Land-based | owner = [[Jack Entertainment]] | license_holder = | architect = | names_pre = | renovations = | website = {{url|jackentertainment.com/cleveland}} | footnotes = }} '''Jack Cleveland Casino''' (formerly '''Horseshoe Cleveland''') is a [[casino]] in [[Downtown Cleveland|downtown]] [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], owned and operated by [[Jack Entertainment]].
==Casino== Jack Cleveland Casino is located in the former [[Higbee's|Higbee Building]] at [[Tower City Center]] in downtown Cleveland.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2015/07/tower_city_the_avenue_-_mall_m.html|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|title=Tower City falters after big name beginning (vintage photos)|date=July 13, 2015|accessdate=May 11, 2016|first=Brenda|last=Cain}}</ref> It has {{convert|100000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}} of gaming space. The casino has 1,609 slot machines, 119 table games, and 35 electronic table games. The casino is accessible from Public Square, but is also accessible from the [[Terminal Tower]] and the Tower City Center shopping mall. The casino has teamed with the Renaissance, the Ritz-Carlton, and the [[Marriott at Key Center]] to offer rooms to its guests, and Rock Ohio Caesars purchased the Ritz-Carlton from [[Forest City Enterprises]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Michelle|last=Jarboe McFee |title=Rock Ohio Caesars to buy Ritz-Carlton in downtown Cleveland, acquires 250 Huron offices |url=http://www.cleveland.com/business/index.ssf/2011/12/rock_ohio_caesars_to_buy_cleve.html|work=[[The Plain Dealer]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|date=December 9, 2011|accessdate=October 16, 2012}}</ref> The casino is open 24 hours a day and is completely smoke-free, compliant with Ohio law. Since the casino has limited dining options, it has partnered with nearly a dozen downtown Cleveland restaurants.
==History== Ohio voters approved (53%) a state constitutional amendment in November 2009 authorizing casinos in the state’s four largest cities: Cleveland, Cincinnati, Columbus and Toledo.<ref>Sheeran, Thomas. "Horseshoe Casino, Cleveland Casino, Opens To The Public". AP.org. Associated Press, 14 May. 2012. Web. 12 Dec 2012.</ref> It was the fifth statewide vote to legalize gambling in Ohio over 20 years.<ref>Ott, Thomas. "All Bets Are on." The Plain Dealer [Cleveland] 15 May 2012: A1+. Print.</ref>
Horseshoe Cleveland opened on May 14, 2012 as the first casino in the state of Ohio.<ref>{{cite news |first=Thomas|last=Ott|title=Ohio begins casino gambling era in Cleveland |url=http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2012/05/ohio_begins_casino_gambling_er.html|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|date=May 14, 2012|accessdate=October 16, 2012}}</ref> It was developed by Rock Ohio Caesars, a joint venture between [[Caesars Entertainment Corporation|Caesars Entertainment]] and [[Dan Gilbert (businessman)|Dan Gilbert]]'s [[Rock Ventures#Gaming|Rock Gaming]], and managed by Caesars.
[[Hollywood Casino Toledo]], developed and operated by [[Penn National Gaming]], opened on May 29, followed by Hollywood Columbus, which opened on October 8, 2012.<ref>"More competition for Detroit: Second Ohio casino opens in Toledo." Ap.org. Associated Press, 29 May. 2012. Web. 12 Dec 2012.</ref> Rock Ohio Caesars also developed [[Horseshoe Casino Cincinnati]], which opened on March 4, 2013.<ref>Coolidge, Alexander. "Cincy casino to open March 4." Cincinnati.com. Cincinnati Enquirer, 12 Dec. 2012. Web. 12 Dec 2012.</ref>
Gross casino revenues are taxed at 33 percent, one of the highest rates in the nation for a resort casino with this level of investment. Portions of the tax revenue are designated for public school districts; the four host cities; all 88 state counties; the Ohio State Racing Commission; law enforcement training; and research and treatment of problem gambling and substance abuse.<ref>Myers, Amanda. "Cincinnati casino on pace to open in spring". AP.org. Associated Press, 6 Sep. 2012. Web. 12 Dec 2012.</ref> The bipartisan Ohio Casino Control Commission was created in 2011 to develop rules for casino gaming in Ohio, to license operators and to regulate and ensure the integrity of operations. It is also funded by casino tax revenue.<ref>Bell, Jeff. "Casino commission's hiring spree to begin." Bizjournals.com. Cincinnati Business Courier, 12 Dec. 2012. Web. 12 Dec 2012.</ref>
Rock Gaming acquired Caesars Entertainment's 20% stake in Rock Ohio Caesars in February 2015,<ref name="clev215">{{Cite news|title=Rock Ohio Ventures buy Caesar's 20 percent interest and now owns Horseshoe Casino Cleveland, ThistleDown and other entities|first=Karen|last=Farkas|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|date=February 26, 2015|accessdate=May 4, 2016|url=http://www.cleveland.com/casino/index.ssf/2015/02/rock_ohio_ventures_buys_out_ca.html}}</ref> and later in the year announced that it would assume management of the properties, including Horseshoe Cleveland.<ref name="clev1115">{{Cite news|title=Rock Gaming takes over management of Horseshoe Cleveland Casino from Caesar's Entertainment|first=Karen|last=Farkas|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|date=November 2, 2015|accessdate=May 4, 2016|url=http://www.cleveland.com/casino/index.ssf/2015/11/rock_gaming_takes_over_management_of_horseshoe_cleveland_casino_from_caesars_entertainment.html}}</ref> Rock Gaming announced in February 2016 that the company and its casinos would rebrand under the Jack name.<ref name="detnews216">{{Cite news | title = Greektown Casino to be renamed ‘Jack’ | author =Michael Martinez|work=[[The Detroit News]]|publisher=[[Digital First Media]]|date=February 23, 2016|accessdate=May 4, 2016|url=http://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/2016/02/23/greektown-casino-renamed-jack/80802634/}}</ref> The casino closed for 40 hours in May 2016 to undergo its transition to the Jack name and management.<ref>{{cite news|title=Horseshoe Casino Cleveland closing May 10 for 40 hours to become Jack Casino|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|author=Karen Farkas|date=May 2, 2016|url=http://www.cleveland.com/casino/index.ssf/2016/05/horseshoe_casino_cleveland_clo.html|accessdate=May 4, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Jack Cleveland Casino opens for business after transformation from Horseshoe|work=[[The Plain Dealer|Cleveland.com]]|publisher=[[Advance Publications]]|location=[[Cleveland]]|first=Karen|last=Farkas|date=May 11, 2016|url=http://www.cleveland.com/casino/index.ssf/2016/05/jack_cleveland_casino_is_open.html|accessdate=May 12, 2016}}</ref>
==See also== {{Portal|Ohio}} *[[List of Caesars Entertainment properties]] *[[List of casinos in Ohio]]

{{good article}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = James Ludington | image =James Ludington c 1880.jpg | image_size =200 px | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1827|4|18}} | birth_place = [[Carmel, New York|Carmel]], [[Putnam County, New York|Putnam County]], [[New York (state)|New York]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1891|4|1|1827|4|18}} | death_cause = | resting_place =Milwaukee, Wisconsin | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = Milwaukee, Wisconsin | nationality = [[Americans|American]] | education = | occupation = Businessman, entrepreneur | employer = Self-employed | known_for = Developing [[Ludington, Michigan]] | title = | term = | predecessor = | party = Republican | spouse = Never married | parents = [[Lewis Ludington]], father | relatives = {{unbulleted list |{{nowrap|Abigail and [[Henry Ludington]] (grandparents)}} |[[Sybil Ludington]] (aunt) |Charles H. Ludington (brother) |Amelia, Delia, Lavinia and Emily (sisters) <!-- Needs to be included in the body as well --> | [[Harrison Ludington]] (cousin) }} | signature =James Ludington signature.svg }}
'''James Ludington''' (April 18, 1827 – April 1, 1891) was an American [[entrepreneur]], businessman, lumber baron, and [[Real estate development|real estate developer]].<ref name ="MCHS303">{{harvnb|Mason County|1980|p=303}}</ref><ref name ="MCHS11">{{harvnb|Mason County|1980|p=11}}</ref> As a businessman he would loan money to other businessmen. In one such loan he had to foreclose for delinquent payments on a sawmill operation in Michigan. He ultimately obtained the sawmill in the village of Pere Marquette. Ludington platted the land there and formed a town with a lumber company operation. He later sold his interest to the lumber company for a large sum of money and became very wealthy. The town later changed its name and became [[Ludington, Michigan]], although he never lived there.
== Biography==
James was born in [[Carmel, New York|Carmel]], [[New York (state)|New York]] on April 18, 1827.<ref name ="Johnson227">{{Harvnb|Johnson|1907|p=227}}</ref> In 1843, the [[Ludington family]] moved from New York to [[Milwaukee]], [[Wisconsin]], when James was 16. James and his father, [[Lewis Ludington]], founded [[Columbus, Wisconsin]] in 1845.<ref name ="MCHS303"/><ref name ="Johnson227"/> In 1849, [[Utah Territory|Utah Territorial]] Governor, [[Brigham Young]], wrote to Ludington, soliciting his help in the construction of a paper mill in the [[Salt Lake Valley]]. Ludington planned to travel west to supervise the mill's construction, but the deal was never completed.<ref>Ludington to Young, 1850 Jan 7, Feb 22, Mar 20. Brigham Young Papers. Church History Library. Salt Lake City, Utah.</ref>
On October 11, 1854, Ludington loaned funds to [[George W. Ford]] for a sawmill operation in what was then known as the village of Pere Marquette in the northwestern part of the [[Lower Peninsula of Michigan]]. When Ford defaulted on the loan and became insolvent in 1859, Ludington took over the operations of this sawmill.<ref name ="MCHS303"/><ref name ="MCHS11"/><ref name="cabot14">{{Harvnb|Cabot|2005|p=14}}</ref>
In 1854, Ludington filed for the purchase of unsold school land from the state of Wisconsin that was believed to contain some {{Convert|70000|acres|abbr=off}}. The sale was challenged and ultimately cancelled when the parcel was identified as containing over {{Convert|200000|acres|abbr=off}}. The purchase was re-filed after a further effort to specify which parcels were included. In 1855, the arrangements behind Ludington's purchase were investigated by James Halpin and Dr. Hunt, as to the amount of funds and whether they were properly appropriated. In 1856, Ludington was implicated in a bribery and fraud scheme surrounding the sale. He was cleared of wrongdoing after a lengthy legislative investigation and public testimony.<ref>{{Harvnb|Joint Committee|1856|pp=26–63}}</ref><ref>{{Harvnb|Tuttle|1875|pp=293–296}}</ref>
Ludington platted 360 acres of the land around Pere Marquette in 1867 and sold lots to individuals, developing the town.{{sfn|MasonCounty 1882|1882|p=19}} In the same year, he built a large commercial building, called "The Big Store" that sold a variety of goods. Also at that time Ludington founded the first newspaper in the village, the ''Mason County Record''.<ref name ="MCHS303"/><ref name ="MCHS11"/><ref name = "cabot14"/> The sawmill that Ludington acquired developed into an independent entity, called the Pere Marquette Lumber Company, which operated and managed the sawmill and The Big Store. On July 24, 1869, Ludington sold his interests to the company for half a million dollars, making him a very wealthy person. Ludington used a portion of this money to develop the village. On March 22, 1873, the city of Ludington was chartered.<ref name ="MCHS303"/><ref name ="MCHS11"/><ref name="Michigan150" />
Ludington lived in New York state as a boy and in Wisconsin as an adult,<ref name ="MCHS303"/><ref name ="Johnson227"/> but never lived in [[Ludington, Michigan]], the town that bears his name.<ref>{{harvnb|Mason County|1980|p=303|ps=: ''He never married and he never lived in the city which bears his name.''}}</ref> The streets of Ludington Avenue and James Street are named after him. The streets Lewis, William, Robert, Charles, Harrison, Emily, Lavina, and Delia are named after his family members.<ref name ="MCHS11"/> Ludington died on April 1, 1891, in his residence at [[John Plankinton#Plankinton House Hotel|Plankinton House Hotel]] in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.<ref name="Michigan150" /> He is buried at Carmel where he was born.<ref name=obit1>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=James Ludington passes away |url= https://www.newspapers.com/clip/16740202/ |work= Chicago Tribune, page 5 |location= Chicago, Illinois |date= April 2, 1891 |via=[[Newspapers.com]] {{open access}} }}</ref><ref name=obit2>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title= James Ludington is dead|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=Ew8aAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ZSAEAAAAIBAJ&pg=6635%2C12370 |work=Milwaukee Journal |location=Milwaukee, Wisconsin |date= April 1, 1891|access-date=January 21, 2018 }}</ref>
==Positions==
At one time or another, Ludington held the following positions:<ref name="Michigan150">{{Cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=110&dat=19870418&id=4RNQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=1lUDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4438,7466335&hl=ens|title=Focus on our history|last=Michigan Sesquicentennial|first=|date=April 18, 1987|work=|access-date=April 1, 2017|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|via=Google News|website=The Ludington Daily News}}</ref> *[[Treasurer]] of La Crosse Railroad ([[La Crosse, Wisconsin]]) *President of Bank of the West ([[Madison, Wisconsin]]) *Vice-President of the Juneau Bank (Milwaukee, Wisconsin) *[[Alderman]] in the city of Milwaukee, Wisconsin
== See also == * [[Nelson Ludington]] * [[Henry Ludington]]

revision.text:
'''Kick the cat''' (or '''kick the dog'''<ref name=pt>{{cite journal|url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/articles/200509/learning-not-lash-out|title=Learning Not to Lash Out|work=Psychology Today|first=Kat|last=McGowan|date=1 September 2005|accessdate=5 February 2015}}</ref>) is a [[metaphor]] used to describe how a relatively high-ranking person in an organization or family [[Displacement (psychology)|displaces]] his or her frustrations by abusing a lower-ranking person, who may in turn take it out on his or her own subordinate.
==Origin of the idiom== The term has been used at least since the 19th century.<ref>{{cite journal|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DHwXAAAAYAAJ&pg=RA2-PA35&dq=%22kick+the+cat%22+business&hl=en&sa=X&ei=NrV1VNC5BbOUsQS7yYKQCg&ved=0CEYQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=%22kick%20the%20cat%22%20business&f=false|title=Journal of Proceedings of the ... Annual Convention of Young Men's Christian Associations of the United States and British Provinces, Volume 14|p=35|year=1869}}</ref> According to author John Bradshaw, humans were far more cruel to cats at that time, to the extent that kicking one was not perceived to be unusual and hence entered the language as a popular idiom.<ref>{{cite book|title=Cat Sense: How the New Feline Science Can Make You a Better Friend to Your Pet|first=John|last=Bradshaw|p=194|publisher=Basic Books|year=2013|isbn=978-0-465-04095-7}}</ref>
The concept was reinforced in British culture by a scene in the ''[[Blackadder]]'' episode ''[[Nob and Nobility]]'' in which Edmund Blackadder kicks the cat when annoyed, and the cat bites the mouse, and the mouse bites Baldrick.
In current usage, the name envisions a scenario where an angry or frustrated employee comes home from work looking for some way to take out his anger, but the only thing present is the cat. He physically abuses it as a means of relieving his frustration, despite the cat playing no part in causing it.<ref name="glass">{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=HWy2GlYGDx0C&pg=PT80&lpg=PT80&dq=kick+the+cat+syndrome&source=bl&ots=2EgZkGoIvF&sig=U8Gf-TrF4cZLZII107iJg0nv8-o&hl=en&sa=X&ei=cLJ1VMNKhsaxBIaggtgP&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=kick%20the%20cat%20syndrome&f=false|title=The Complete Idiot's Guide to Verbal Self Defense|first=Lillian|last=Glass|p=80|publisher=Penguin|year=1999|isbn=978-1-440-65074-1}}</ref>
==Workplace or family dynamics== Kicking the cat is commonly used to describe the behaviour of staff abusing coworkers or subordinates as a mechanism to relieve [[Occupational stress|stress]].<ref name="quinn">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/money/2007/jul/23/careers.theguardian5|title=With colleagues like these|first=Catherine|last=Quinn|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=23 July 2007|accessdate=26 November 2014}}</ref> This behaviour can result in a [[chain reaction]], where a higher-ranking member of the company abuses his or her subordinate, who takes it out on his or her own subordinate, and so on down the line. This [[domino effect]] can also be seen in family dynamics, where the father yells at the mother who yells at the older child who yells at the younger child who yells at the pet.<ref>Cooney, Beth, [http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/1999-05-02/features/9904290688_1_chain-reaction-nuclear-families-emotions Grumpy Ol' Dad], Sun-Sentinel, May 2, 1999. Retrieved 5 February 2015.</ref>
[[Blaming]] others can lead to kicking the dog where individuals in a [[hierarchy]] blame their immediate subordinate, and this propagates down a hierarchy until the lowest rung (the "dog"). A 2009 experimental study has shown that blaming can be contagious even for uninvolved onlookers.<ref>Jeanna Bryner: [http://livescience.com/culture/blame-contagious-100119.html Workplace Blame Is Contagious and Detrimental], [[LiveScience]], 2010-01-19, citing the January 2010 issue of the ''[[Journal of Experimental Social Psychology]]''.'. </ref>
==Psychological theories== According to ''Psychology Today'', "Anger and frustration in one part of life can lead us to lash out at innocent people (or pets) in another."<ref name=pt/> The technical term for this kind of behaviour is "displaced aggression".<ref name=pt/>
Kicking the cat is looked upon unfavourably and viewed as a sign of poor [[anger management]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nLm2C_J9A90C&pg=PA147&dq=%22kick+the+cat%22+business&hl=en&sa=X&ei=NrV1VNC5BbOUsQS7yYKQCg&ved=0CFsQuwUwCA#v=onepage&q=%22kick%20the%20cat%22%20business&f=false|title=Understanding and Training Your Cat or Kitten|first=H. Ellen|last=Whiteley|p=147|publisher=Sunstone Press|isbn=978-1-611-39080-3|quote="Learn to handle anger or quit the job"}}</ref> According to author Steve Sonderman, "Men funnel 90 percent of their emotions through anger" and may "kick the cat" as a substitute for grief, [[anxiety]] or other emotions.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iv47hJxGc0EC&pg=PA168&dq=%22kick+the+cat%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=frB1VMKMFqyZsQSv3oLIDw&ved=0CEQQuwUwBg#v=onepage&q=%22kick%20the%20cat%22&f=false|title=Mobilizing Men for One-on-One Ministry: The Transforming Power of Authentic Friendship and Discipleship|first=Steve|last=Sonderman|p=168|publisher=Bethany House|year=2010|isbn=978-1-441-21376-1}}</ref>{{Dubious |reason=A 'Christian author' is not a 'psychology expert', and the claim is outlandish and unsupported.|date=September 2016}} Psychology author [[Raj Persaud]] suggests that people "kick the cat" as a means of [[catharsis]] because they fear expressing their full emotions to the peers and colleagues.<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=E86iK3a2mEUC&pg=PA299&lpg=PA299&dq=kick+the+cat+syndrome&source=bl&ots=kKld8O5Z7D&sig=_LsxyfIhnjvAioJpC_wni0JtqIY&hl=en&sa=X&ei=hFR3VPS1OtO1sASp9YLwDQ&ved=0CCAQ6AEwADgU#v=onepage&q=kick%20the%20cat%20syndrome&f=false|title=Staying Sane|first=Raj|last=Persaud|authorlink=Raj Persaud|publisher=Random House|year=2011|isbn=978-144-811106-0}}</ref>
==See also== {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| * [[Abusive supervision]] * [[Bullying culture]] * [[:Fit in or fuck off]] * [[Kiss up kick down]] * [[Hostile attribution bias]] * [[Presumption of guilt]] * [[Psychological projection]] * [[Scapegoating]] }}
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
{{Aspects of organizations}} {{Workplace}} {{Bullying}}

{{Infobox person | name = Lucien Barrière | image = Lucien BarrièreO9.JPG | image_size = | caption = |birth_name = Lucien Barrière |birth_date = 14 January 1923 |birth_place = [[Rosières, Ardèche|Rosières]], France | death_date = {{Death date and age|1990|9|17|1923|1|14}} | death_place = [[Caen]], France |nationality = {{FRA}} | residence = | education = | alma_mater = | occupation = | networth = | religion = | spouse = | children = | parents = | known_for = | website = }}
'''Lucien Barrière''' (14 January 1923 – 17 September 1990) was a French entrepreneur and [[businessman]]. He was the heir and founder of the [[Lucien Barrière group]], one of the largest group of casinos, luxury hotels, resorts and restaurants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.challenges.fr/entreprise/20130606.CHA0316/bluffant-dominique-desseigne-pdg-de-groupe-lucien-barriere.html|title=Bluffant - Dominique Desseigne, PDG de Groupe Lucien Barrière|work=Challenges|date=June 7, 2013|language=fr}}</ref>
==Biography==
He was born in the French Ardèche region from a modest, goat raising family.
In 1962, he was chosen by his uncle François André, who had no direct descendants, to succeed him as head of several successful companies specializing in the operation of [[casino]]s and luxury hotels.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abcbourse.com/apprendre/biographie_lucien_barriere-98|title=Lucien Barriere|work=ABC Bourse|date=|language=fr}}</ref> The casinos of [[Deauville]], [[Cannes]] and [[La Baule]] and the hotels Normandy Barriere, Royal Barriere and the Hotel du Golf Barriere de Deauville were among the best known assets of the company.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.normandie-tourisme.fr/Hotel-du-Golf-Barriere/HOT/SAINT-ARNOULT/fiche-HOTNOR014FS001S9-2.html|title=Hotel du Golf Barrière|work=Normandy Tourism|date=}}</ref>
In 1959, he became the general manager of the group. For thirty years he developed the successful Barriere empire following the same policy as his predecessor: luxury, sophistication, perfection, elegance, refinement, friendliness and cultivating the French [[joie de vivre]].
He married Martha Szentgyörgyi (died October 11, 2008), a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] dancer. Martha had a daughter from a previous marriage, Diane, born in 1957, which he adopted and raised as his own. He taught her the know-how of the trade, before designating her as the sole heir of his luxury empire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.parismatch.com/Actu/Economie/Dominique-Desseigne-se-devoile-pour-Paris-Match-et-parle-de-ses-relations-avec-Rachida-Dati-136419|title=Dominique Desseigne se dévoile pour PAris Match et parle de ses relations avec Rachida Dati|work=Paris Match|date=October 2, 2012|language=fr}}</ref>
In 1962, he founded the [[Lucien Barrière group]], one of the first French companies charged with managing casinos and luxury hotels.
In 1975, Lucien Barrière sponsored the creation of the [[American Film Festival]] in Deauville, alongside the major proponents of this idea, the Mayor of Deauville [[Michel d'Ornano]], André Halimi and Lionel Shushan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.confidentielles.com/r_13496_le-parcours-de-lucien-barriere.htm|title=Le parcours de Lucien Barrière|work=Confidentielles|date=|language=fr}}</ref>
In 1990, he died at Caen University Hospital of cardiac arrest at the age of 67, following complications resulting from a [[coronary angioplasty]] carried out by Professor Grollier. Diane, married to the notary Dominique Desseigne, succeeded her adoptive father as head of the group and pursued the same successful policy as her predecessors. In July 1995 she was the victim of a serious plane crash that left her [[quadriplegic]], and later died in May 2001 at 44 years<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hellocoton.fr/to/PaP#http://www.purepeople.com/article/mort-de-martha-barriere-du-groupe-barriere_a17126/1|title=Mort de MArtha Barrière, du groupe Barrière...|work=Pure People|date=|language=fr}}</ref>{{,}}.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.labandearuquier.com/Hommage-a-Martha-Barriere-l-amie.html|title=Hommage à Martha Barrière, l'ami de Steevy|work=La bande à Ruquier|date=|language=fr}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

[[File:Maus Gatsonides (1964).jpg|thumb|Maus Gatsonides (1964)]] '''Maurice''' ("Maus") '''Gatsonides''' (February 14, 1911 in [[Gombong]], [[Kebumen Regency]] – November 29, 1998 in [[Heemstede]]) was a Dutch [[rally driver]] and inventor. Gatsonides was born in [[Central Java]] in the former [[Dutch East Indies]] (now [[Indonesia]]). He founded the company "Gatsometer BV" in the Netherlands in 1958.
Today, Gatsonides' fame largely results from inventing the [[Gatso]] speed camera, a speed measuring device used today by many police forces to catch [[speeding]] drivers. He originally invented the Gatso speed camera to measure his cornering speed in an attempt to improve his driving.
==Motor racing== Gatsonides is primarily known for inventing the [[speed camera]], but his primary interest was in motor racing.<ref>http://www.supercars.net/cars/302.html</ref> [[File:1948 Gatso 1500 Sport (37977905262).jpg|thumb|Gatso 1500 Sport, aka "Platje", 1948]]Maurice was passionate about racing and raced in many events. However, in 1949, he built his own car. It was nicknamed the "Platje" (English: "Flatty") because of its aerodynamic shape. The car caused a sensation at the Dutch [[Circuit Park Zandvoort|Zandvoort Racetrack]], passing all of the opponents including [[MG Cars|MG]]'s. Maurice was forced to sell the Flatty to pay creditors after trying to put his own V8 sportscar into production. The Flatty however, survived. It was found abandoned in the 1970s and has now been restored by Joop Bruggeman. It is the last surviving Gatso car. Gatsonides won the [[Monte Carlo Rally]] in 1953 driving a [[Ford Zephyr]].
<!--- Information from merge but needs referencing and reformatting The Gatso Flatty stats BUILT: 1949 in Heemsteede, Holland ENGINE: Six-cylinder, 1500cc TOP SPEED: Unknown SOLD IN THE UK? No NUMBER BUILT? 1

revision.comment: Added an importan tplayer in this field, added technologies used when presenting a media intelligence platform, like Semantic tagging, Natural LAnguage processing, etc
revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{notability|Neologisms|date=February 2015}} {{refimprove|date=February 2015}} }}
'''Media Intelligence''' uses data mining and [[data science]] to analyze public [[social content|social]] and editorial [[media content]]. It refers to marketing systems that synthesize billions of [[online conversation]]s into relevant information that allow organizations to measure and manage content performance, understand trends, and drive communications and [[business strategy]].
Media intelligence can include [[software as a service]] using [[big data]] terminology.<ref name=FT>{{cite web |title= Digital Breadcrumbs and the New Media Intelligence |author= Leslie Nuccio |date= January 19, 2015 |url=http://www.socialmediatoday.com/content/digital-breadcrumbs-and-new-media-intelligence |publisher=Social Media Today |access-date= March 23, 2017 }}</ref> This includes questions about messaging efficiency, [[share of voice]], audience geographical distribution, message amplification, [[influencer]] strategy, journalist outreach, creative resonance, and competitor performance in all these areas.
Media intelligence differs from [[business intelligence]] in that it uses and analyzes data outside company [[firewall (computing)|firewall]]s. Examples of that data are [[user-generated content]] on social media sites, [[blog]]s, comment fields, and wikis etc. It may also include other public data sources like [[press release]]s, news, blogs, legal filings, reviews and job postings.
Media Intelligence may also include competitive intelligence, wherein information that is gathered from publicly available sources such as social media, press releases, and news announcements are used to better understand the strategies and tactics being deployed by competing businesses.
Media Intelligence is enhanced by means of emerging technologies like [[semantic tagging]], [[Natural language processing|Natural Language Processing]], [[sentiment analysis]] and [[machine translation]].
==Technologies used== Different media intelligence platforms use different technologies for [[Internet surveillance|monitoring]], curating content, engaging with content, data analysis and measurement of communications and marketing campaign success. These technology providers, such as [https://www.buzzcovery.com BuzzCovery] [[Meltwater (company)|Meltwater]], [http://www.synoptos.com Synoptos], [[Salesforce.com|Radian 6]], or Sysomos may obtain content by scraping content directly from websites or by connecting to the API provided by social media or other content platforms that are created for 3rd party developers to develop their own applications and services that access data. [[Facebook Graph Search|Facebook's Graph API]] is one such API that social media monitoring solution products would connect to pull data from.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api |title=Graph API |date= |accessdate=2015-05-14}}</ref> Technology companies may also get '''data from a data reseller,''' such as DataSift (acquired by Meltwater), Gnip (acquired by [[Twitter]]), LexisNexis, or Dow Jones/Factiva.
Some social media monitoring and analytics companies use calls to data providers each time an end-user develops a query. Others archive and index social media posts to provide end users with on-demand access to historical data and enable methodologies and technologies leveraging network and relational data. Additional monitoring companies use crawlers and spidering technology to find keyword references, known as [[semantic analysis (linguistics)|semantic analysis]] or [[natural language processing]]. Basic implementation involves curating data from social media on a large scale and analyzing the results to make sense out of it.<ref>{{cite journal |last1=De |first1=Shaunak |last2=Maity |first2=Abhishek |last3=Goel |first3=Vritti |last4=Shitole |first4=Sanjay |last5=Bhattacharya |first5=Avik |title=Predicting the popularity of instagram posts for a lifestyle magazine using deep learning |journal=2nd IEEE International Conference on Communication Systems, Computing and IT Applications (CSCITA) |date=2017 |page=174-177 |doi=10.1109/CSCITA.2017.8066548}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Media monitoring]] * [[Social media intelligence]] * [[Social media monitoring]]
