https://web.archive.org/web/20150518085234/http://www.midemfestival.com/2014/en/shila-amzah/|dead-url = yes|archive-date = 18 May 2015|title = Shila Amzah – Midem Festival|author = |date = |work = Midem Festival|accessdate = 25 October 2015}} Princess of Music,{{Cite web|title = Singapore's 3rd stint hosting the 15th Global Chinese Music Awards 2015|url = http://thefifthparlour.com/2015/11/08/singapores-3rd-stint-hosting-the-15th-global-chinese-music-awards-2015/|website = The Fifth Parlour|accessdate = 12 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160220142409/http://thefifthparlour.com/2015/11/08/singapores-3rd-stint-hosting-the-15th-global-chinese-music-awards-2015/|archivedate = 20 February 2016|df = dmy-all}} and National Treasure of Malaysia.{{Cite web|title = 茜拉首次來港會歌迷 - 香港文匯報|url = http://paper.wenweipo.com/2015/10/02/EN1510020021.htm|website = paper.wenweipo.com|accessdate =26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160113130556/http://paper.wenweipo.com/2015/10/02/EN1510020021.htm|archivedate = 13 January 2016|df = dmy-all}} Shila was the first runner-up of ''Bintang Kecil RTM'' in 2000, first runner-up of ''[[One in a Million (Malaysian TV series)|One in a Million]]'' ([[One in a Million (season 2)|season 2]]),{{Cite web|url=http://www.murai.com.my/berita/tempatan/article/articleid/354041/laluan-ayu-oiam-semakin-cerah|title=Laluan Ayu OIAM Semakin Cerah|website=www.murai.com.my|access-date=22 March 2016}}{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=Lingzhi |fix-attempted=yes }} winner of ''[[Asia New Singer Competition]]'' in 2008, second runner-up of ''I Am a Singer'' (season 2) in 2014, and first runner-up of ''[[Anugerah Juara Lagu]]'' in 2011 and 2015. Before the ''[[Asian Wave]]'', she performed a duet with [[Miley Cyrus]] called "[[The Best of Both Worlds (song)|The Best of Both Worlds]]" to promote [[Hannah Montana]] in Malaysia. In 2013, Shila was the first Malay and Malaysian artist to be nominated at the World Music Awards after winning ''Asian Wave'' as well being the first and only Malay artist to be invited to the Global Chinese Music Awards (GCMA).{{Cite web|url=http://thefifthparlour.com/2015/11/08/singapores-3rd-stint-hosting-the-15th-global-chinese-music-awards-2015/|title=Singapore's 3rd stint hosting the 15th Global Chinese Music Awards 2015|last=Parlour|first=The Fifth|website=The Fifth Parlour|access-date=22 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160220142409/http://thefifthparlour.com/2015/11/08/singapores-3rd-stint-hosting-the-15th-global-chinese-music-awards-2015/|archivedate=20 February 2016|df=dmy-all}} She is the first and only Malay artist to have success in Chinese-speaking countries and Chinese record charts with her [[Sina Weibo]] account having more than 2.3 million followers. She was listed in the [[Forbes|''Forbes''']] [[Forbes 30 Under 30|30 Under 30 Asia]] (2018), recognizing young leaders, entrepreneurs and game changers from across Asia under Entertainment and Sports category.{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/30-under-30-asia/2018/#52f680205aeb|title=30 Under 30 Asia 2018|website=Forbes|access-date=2018-03-27}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.hmetro.com.my/utama/2018/03/325100/terbaik-shila-amzah|title=Terbaik Shila Amzah!|date=2018-03-27|work=HM Online|access-date=2018-03-27|language=ms}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/shila-amzah/|title=Shila Amzah|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-03-27|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.bharian.com.my/berita/nasional/2018/03/404504/7-wakil-malaysia-dalam-forbes-under-30-asia-2018|title=7 wakil Malaysia dalam Forbes Under 30 Asia 2018|date=2018-03-27|work=BH Online|access-date=2018-03-27|language=ms}} Shila used the stage name "NurShahila" name when she was a child.{{Citation|last=TheMalamBULAN|title=IBU - SHILA TEKNO|date=31 May 2010|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4A_NT1YW51U|accessdate= 22 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111023170356/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4A_NT1YW51U&gl=US&hl=en|archivedate=23 October 2011|df=dmy-all}} In 2004, she changed her name to Sha-Hila as her record company, EMI, wanted her name to be shorter. When she joined the ''One in a Million'' singing contest she needed to make her name even shorter. The organiser of ''One in a Million'' (Season 2) truncated her name to just Shila. After coming in as the first runner-up of ''One in A Million'' (season 2), she was called "Shila OIAM". She didn't like the name, so she added "Amzah" to her stage name, as her father's name is Amir Amzah. In Chinese-speaking countries, Shila's name is 茜拉 (Xila).{{Cite web|url=http://weibo.com/shila|title=ShilaAmzah茜拉|website=weibo.com|access-date=22 March 2016}} == Life and career == === 1990–2000: Early life === NurShahila binti Amir Amzah was born on 13 August 1990, in Setapak, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Her father, Amir Amzah Salleh, who used the stage name ND Lala, was a recording artist in the 1980s and her mother, Fauziah Sarman, was an actress. She comes from a musically inclined family: her younger sister, NurSyuhada, whose stage name is Syada Amzah, is also a performer. She attended Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan Setapak Indah, Kuala Lumpur. === 2000–2007: Early commercial success === Before Shila made her debut appearance as a child, her father struggled to get her a chance to showcase her singing. At that time, there were no recording companies that wanted to sign children as recording artists as they did not want to take the risk. So her father used his own money to produce her first album. In 2000, Shila's debut album, Terima Kasih Guru that was launched in the presence of [[Siti Hasmah Mohamad Ali|Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah]], wife of Malaysia's fourth Prime Minister, [[Mahathir Mohamad|Tun Dr. Mahathir]]. She later signed a contract with EMI. With EMI, she released the album ''Sha-Hila'' with the hit song "Yang Teristimewa". === 2007–2009: Career development === After her contract with EMI ended in 2007, she joined ''[[One in a Million (Malaysian TV series)|One in a Million]]'' (Season 2) and emerged as first runner-up of the competition. The nickname "Shila" was given by the organizers of ''One in a Million'' as her SMS voting code and name during the singing competition. On the night of the Grand Finale of ''One in a Million'' (season 2), Shila was assigned to sing a new song called "Memori Tercipta" (Memories Created). She lost to Norayu Damit, but both of them were given recording contracts from [[Monkey Bone Records]]. Throughout the competition, Shila sang: * Top 12: "Tak Ada Logika" * Week 1: "Too Little Too Late" * Week 2: "Stuck" * Week 3: "Oops!... I Did It Again" * Week 4: "Di Bawah Pohon Asmara " * Week 5: "I'll Be There" * Week 6: "Car Wash" * Week 7: "Khayal" with Alif Satar * Week 8: "Contigo en la Distancia" * Week 9: "Bukan Milikmu and Love Like This" * Grand Finale: "Contigo en la Distancia", "Memori Tercipta" and "Oops!... I Dit It Again with Stuck" Medley She produced the album ''Bebaskan ''(Set It Free) during her stint with Monkey Bone Records. The album was launched in 2009. With 12 songs, featuring the works of Malaysian composers such as Aubrey Suwito, Audi Mok, Kieran Kuek and Mode, as well as Australian composer Jamie Huber. === 2010–2012: Career expansion === ''[[3 Suara]]'' (English: 3 Voices) is a [[Collaboration|collaborative]] [[album]] by Malaysian singers [[Jaclyn Victor]], [[Ning Baizura]] and Shila Amzah. The album was released on 6 January 2011, through Euphoric Pte. Limited.{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/3-suara/id545207890|title=3 Suara by Jaclyn Victor, Ning Baizura Hamzah & Shila Amzah on iTunes|website=iTunes|access-date=25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160423210940/https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/3-suara/id545207890|archivedate=23 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} One of Shila's songs was "[[Patah Seribu]]". The song appeared on many television shows and received a lot of radio airtime. The song was nominated at the Malaysian Music Awards for Best Female Vocal Performance and Most Popular Regional Song and won Pop Song of the Year and Song of the Year. The song was released as a single on [[iTunes]] on 20 July 2012 by Urustabil and was later added as a bonus track to her fifth studio album, ''[[Shila Amzah (album)|Shila Amzah]]'', released by Shila Amzah Entertainment Berhad. === 2012–2014: Early international stardom === In September 2012, she was invited to join the inaugural competition of ''[[Asian Wave]]'', a Chinese reality singing talent show held in Shanghai, China, after her father, ND Lala submitted her videos singing. On 20 September 2012, Shila became the champion.{{Cite web|url=http://news.asiaone.com/News/Latest%252BNews/Showbiz/Story/A1Story20120925-373536.html|title=News|website=news.asiaone.com|access-date=8 May 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160911193150/http://news.asiaone.com/news/Latest%252BNews/Showbiz/Story/A1Story20120925-373536.html|archivedate=11 September 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{cite news|title = Shila Amzah makes waves in Shanghai|url = http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/9/22/nation/12066101&sec=nation|accessdate = 22 September 2012|newspaper = thestar.com.my|date = 22 September 2012|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120923210853/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2012%2F9%2F22%2Fnation%2F12066101&sec=nation|archivedate = 23 September 2012|df = dmy-all}} It was at this point that she started to focus on her career in China.{{Cite web|url=http://www.sinarharian.com.my/shila-amzah-sekarang-keutamaan-kerja-saya-di-china-1.91419|title=Shila Amzah: 'Sekarang, keutamaan kerja saya di China'|last=JOHAR|first=SITI JULIANA MOHD|website=www.sinarharian.com.my|access-date=8 May 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160924075127/http://www.sinarharian.com.my/shila-amzah-sekarang-keutamaan-kerja-saya-di-china-1.91419|archivedate=24 September 2016|df=dmy-all}} Shila had the most online votes among all the contestants. She sang three songs: "[[Gemilang]]" by [[Jaclyn Victor]], "[[Grenade (song)|Grenade]]" by [[Bruno Mars]], and "Zheng Fu" by [[Na Ying]].{{Cite web|title = 《声动亚洲》落幕 马来西亚选手夺冠常石磊惜败_网易娱乐|url = http://ent.163.com/12/0921/00/8BSSI7H000032KMI.html|website = ent.163.com|accessdate = 26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151224103831/http://ent.163.com/12/0921/00/8BSSI7H000032KMI.html|archivedate = 24 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} She also sang "Forever Love" by [[Wang Leehom]] and "[[Set Fire to the Rain]]" by [[Adele]] in one of the preliminary rounds.{{cite news|title = Singer Shila Amzah hitting the high notes|url = http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/9/29/nation/12098173&sec=nation|accessdate = 29 September 2012|newspaper = thestar.com.my|date = 29 September 2012|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121001002625/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2012%2F9%2F29%2Fnation%2F12098173&sec=nation|archivedate = 1 October 2012|df = dmy-all}} The panel of 10 judges-comprising the region's top stars like Malaysia's Eric Moo, Hong Kong's Hacken Lee, China's Sun Nan, Taiwan's Phil Chang and Jerry Huang-gave her a standing ovation, while Chinese composer Gao Xiaosong praised her by saying, "You gave me goose bumps. You broke my heart." She was signed to a 6-year recording contract with Shanghai Media Group and received 5 Million MYR.{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah's 12-year career moves into top gear after she wins Asian Wave contest|url = http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2012/10/05/shilas-12year-career-moves-into-top-gear-after-she-wins-asian-wave-contest/|website = www.thestar.com.my|accessdate = 30 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141205060626/http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2012/10/05/Shilas-12year-career-moves-into-top-gear-after-she-wins-Asian-Wave-contest/|archivedate =5 December 2014|df = dmy-all}}{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah juara Asian Wave di Shanghai|url = http://ww1.utusan.com.my/utusan/Dalam_Negeri/20120922/dn_11/Shila-Amzah-juara-Asian-Wave-di-Shanghai|website = Utusan Online|access-date = 11 January 2016|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160215221458/http://ww1.utusan.com.my/utusan/Dalam_Negeri/20120922/dn_11/Shila-Amzah-juara-Asian-Wave-di-Shanghai|archivedate = 15 February 2016|df = dmy-all}}{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah Menang Juara Tempat Pertama di Asian Wave 2012|url = http://www.budiey.com/shila-amzah-menang-juara-tempat-pertama-di-asian-wave-2012/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 21 September 2012|accessdate =3 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }} {| class="wikitable" ! Episode ! Song ! Language ! Original Singer ! Result ! Defeat |- |Preliminary (Rounds 1) |Set Fire to the Rain |English |[[Adele]] |Advance to
Preliminary Round 2 |{{flagicon|Singapore}} Rachel Chua ''save by judges selection'' |- |Preliminary (Rounds 2) |Forever Love |Mandarin |[[Wang Leehom]] |Advance to
Final Round 1 |{{flagicon|Japan}} [[Emi Tawata]] ''save by judges selection'' |- |Final (Rounds 1) |Gemilang |Malay |[[Jaclyn Victor]] |Advance to
Final Round 2 |{{flagicon|Thailand}} Ten Nararak ''Eliminated'' |- |Final (Rounds 2) |Grenade |English |[[Bruno Mars]] |Advance to
Final Round 3 |{{flagicon|China}} Guo Yifan ''Eliminated'' |- | rowspan="2" |Final (Rounds 3) | rowspan="2" |征服 (Zhengfu, "Conquer") | rowspan="2" |Mandarin | rowspan="2" |[[Na Ying]] | rowspan="2" |'''Champion''' |{{flagicon|China}} [[Chang Shilei]] ''Lost'' |- |{{flagicon|China}} [[Henry Huo]] ''Lost'' |- |} * Shila managed to advance all rounds by ''winning the battle''. * ''Winning the battle'': ''Majority green light pushed by judges'' (similar to coaches of [[The Voice (TV series)|''The Voice'']] in selecting their team). * Other contestant either advanced through winning the battle, judges' selection or by [[a cappella]] battle as a second chance. * Furthermore, there is some contestant that also advanced by extra battle as judges couldn't reach consensus on making their selection. In 2013 she was nominated for the Nickelodeon Kid's Choice Awards for Favourite Asian Act with PSY (South Korea), Han Geng (China), and Sarah Geronimo from the Philippines. ''Harian Metro'' reported on 12 March 2013, that Shila has set up her own record company by the name of Shila Amzah Entertainment Berhad. In July 2013, Shanghai Media Group released "A Moment Like This", Shila's debut Chinese single in China. This single was the theme song for the inaugural competition of ''[[Chinese Idol]]''. She was invited to perform this song live during the grand finale of the show. At the end of 2013, Shila released her fifth studio album, ''[[Shila Amzah (album)|Shila Amzah]]'' released under Shila Amzah Entertainment and distributed by Warner Music Malaysia.{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah di Majlis Pra Dengar Album Terbaru|url = http://www.budiey.com/gambar-shila-amzah-di-majlis-pra-dengar-album-terbaru/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 6 July 2013|accessdate = 24 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }} All songs and lyrics of the album was fully composed by Shila with the guidance of Helen Yap. The album consisted of seven songs including two bonus tracks. The album preview was held at Red Box Plus, Pavilion, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia on 5 July 2013. A further showcase of the album was held at Penthouse, The Icon, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia on 10 October 2013.{{Cite web|title = Showcase Shila Amzah Sukses Shila Rancang Konsert|url = http://www.budiey.com/showcase-shila-amzah-sukses-shila-rancang-konsert/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 20 October 2013|accessdate = 24 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }} The album were produced by Shila, Helen Yap, and Aubrey Suwito, and the sound engineers were Aubrey Suwito, Zairi Ariffin, Yusalman Azua, Hadie Pranoto, Amir Sulaiman and Greg Henderson. The album received nominations from the 21st [[Anugerah Industri Muzik|Malaysian Music Awards]] which is Album of the Year and Engineered Album of the Year. The songs in the album were her first to be nominated at the World Music Awards.The self-titled album, ''Shila Amzah'' was released on digital and streaming platforms on 10 December 2013. In December 2013, Shila released a video of "Masih Aku Cinta".{{Cite web|title = Muzik Video Masih Aku Cinta Shila Amzah Menampilkan Johan As'ari|url = http://www.budiey.com/muzik-video-masih-aku-cinta-nyanyian-shila-amzah/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 4 December 2013|accessdate =24 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }}{{Cite web|title = Gambar Sebalik Tabir Muzik Video Masih Aku Cinta Shila Amzah|url = http://www.budiey.com/gambar-sebalik-tabir-pengambaran-muzik/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 2 December 2013|accessdate = 24 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }} This music video was based on her love story when she broke up with Sharnaaz Ahmad, a Malaysian actor after a controversy involving Sharnaaz Ahmad with Shila's father.{{Cite web|title = Lagu Masih Aku Cinta Shila Amzah Untuk Sharnaaz Ahmad|url = http://www.budiey.com/lagu-aku-masih-cinta-shila-amzah-untuk-sharnaaz-ahmad/|website = budiey.com|publisher = Budiey|date = 15 February 2013|accessdate = 24 December 2015|language = Malay|last = }} ''The Star'' reported on 27 September 2012, that she was chosen to be the opening act for a series of concerts in Beijing by Malaysian singer-composer [[Eric Moo]], starting 17 November.{{cite news|title = Shila Amzah Moo-ves on up as opening act for China tour|url = http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2012/9/27/nation/12088219&sec=nation|accessdate = 29 September 2012|newspaper = thestar.com.my|date = 27 September 2012|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120928143040/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2012%2F9%2F27%2Fnation%2F12088219&sec=nation|archivedate = 28 September 2012|df = dmy-all}} Shila said that she knew him because "he was one of the judges during the competition and his invitation is a huge honor for me". She gave her agreement when he courted her to be part of his opening act. The Eric Moo–Shila Amzah Love Hurricane Concert was eventually held on 24 July 2014. In February 2014, Shila's manager got her an invitation to ''I Am a Singer'' (Season 2). In the 7th round, aired 21 February 2014, she performed the song "Xiang Ni De Ye",{{Cite web|title = 《歌手》茜拉今晚亮相 经纪人吉杰抢戏上台试唱_金鹰网|url = http://www.hunantv.com/c/20140221/1033241367.html|website = www.hunantv.com|accessdate = 26 December 2015|language = Chinese|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227035943/http://www.hunantv.com/c/20140221/1033241367.html|archivedate = 27 December 2015|df = dmy-all}}{{Cite web|title = 马来西亚歌手茜拉上《歌手2》 邓紫棋称没压力-中新网|url = http://www.chinanews.com/yl/2014/02-21/5869283.shtml|website = www.chinanews.com|accessdate = 26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227005200/http://www.chinanews.com/yl/2014/02-21/5869283.shtml|archivedate =27 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} a song originally sung by Chinese pop star Guan Zhe.{{Cite web|title = 《我是歌手》吐槽：茜拉唱歌机器无情感 邓紫棋油条式歌手缺经验（全文）_网易新闻中心|url = http://news.163.com/14/0223/15/9LPEQ2EU00014JB6_all.html|website = news.163.com|accessdate =26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151226234306/http://news.163.com/14/0223/15/9LPEQ2EU00014JB6_all.html|archivedate = 26 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} After the performance her Weibo followers increased rapidly from 1 thousand to over 2 million. In the Breakthrough round, aired 21 March 2014, she reached first place by singing a cover of "Rolling in the Deep".{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah raih tempat ketiga I Am A Singer|url = http://www.astroawani.com/berita-hiburan/shila-amzah-raih-tempat-ketiga-i-am-singer-33268|website = www.astroawani.com|publisher = Astro Awani|accessdate = 3 December 2015|language = Malay|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151208171855/http://www.astroawani.com/berita-hiburan/shila-amzah-raih-tempat-ketiga-i-am-singer-33268|archivedate =8 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} Shila's popularity rose in China after ''I Am a Singer'' aired beside her performance at the ''Asian Wave''. Throughout the show, she showed versatility in her range of music styles, from languages (Chinese and English), performance methods (dancing while singing) and musical styles (high note, pop, R&B, rap). On 4 April 2014, she came third overall,{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah Gagal Raih Gelaran Juara I Am A Singer Musim Kedua|url = http://www.adarain.com/2014/04/shila-amzah-gagal-raih-gelaran-juara-singer-musim-kedua/|publisher = Adarain|access-date = 11 January 2016|language = ms-MY|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160305053843/http://www.adarain.com/2014/04/shila-amzah-gagal-raih-gelaran-juara-singer-musim-kedua/|archivedate = 5 March 2016|df = dmy-all}} losing to [[Han Lei]] from China and [[G.E.M. (singer)|Tang Tsz Kei]] from Hong Kong. Through [[I Am a Singer (season 2)|''I Am a Singer'' (Season 2)]], she was able to quickly adapt to a new language. Being a non-Chinese speaker or singer, she only needed two days to learn a new Chinese song. ''I Am a Singer'' (season 2) helped her in gaining a larger base of China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong fans. Currently, she attends Mandarin classes in Beijing and is working on improving her Mandarin. {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" | Episode ! Airdate ! Song ! Original Singer ! Result |- | colspan="2" |7 (4th Qualifying Round) |21 February 2014 |"想你的夜" (Mandarin) |[[Guan Zhe]] |2 |- | colspan="2" |8 (4th Knockout Round) |28 February 2014 |"最长的电影" (Mandarin) |[[Jay Chou]] |4 |- | colspan="2" |9 (5th Qualifying Round) |7 March 2014 |"Listen" (English) |[[Beyoncé]] |3 |- | colspan="2" |10 (5th Knockout Round) |14 March 2014 |"Forever Love" (Mandarin) |[[Wang Leehom]] |3 |- | colspan="2" |11 (Breakout) |21 March 2014 |"Rolling in the Deep" (English) |[[Adele]] |1 |- | colspan="2" |12 (Semifinal) |28 March 2014 |"洋葱" (Mandarin) |[[Aska Yang|Aska]] |6 |- | rowspan="2" |13 |(1st Final Round) |rowspan=2|4 April 2014 |"When You Believe" (English) |[[Whitney Houston]], [[Mariah Carey]] |— |- |(2nd Final Round) |"MAMA" (Mandarin) |[[Exo (band)|EXO-M]] |3 |- |} * Shila made her debut in 7th Round as she replaced eliminated singer earlier based on the program ''basic rule''. * ''Basic rule'': There must be 7 talented singers as contestants on each episode. === 2015–2017: Hong Kong music scene breakthrough === On 22 April 2015, Shila held a ''Shila Amzah: The Symbol of Love, International Press Conference'' at Mira Hotel, Hong Kong. During the press conference, Shila stated that she would be collaborating with GME Music and Vie Media to expand her career in Hong Kong. She performed her two newest Chinese-language songs called "See You or Never" and "Shali De Mimi". She announced the release an extended play followed by a full album. She mentioned that she plans to learn Cantonese. On 28 May 2015, Shila released her debut Chinese single{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/zai-jian-bu-zai-jian-single/id999768223|title=再見不再見 - Single by Shila Amzah on iTunes|website=iTunes|access-date= 25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160130121823/https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/zai-jian-bu-zai-jian-single/id999768223|archivedate= 30 January 2016|df=dmy-all}} in Hong Kong, "See You or Never'''"''' (Chinese: '''再見不再見''') through Shilala (HK) Limited. The song was written by Liao Yu and composed by Shila herself. This single was performed live during her international press conference''.'' The song reached 1 million streams in just two days on Weibo Music. Shila said that this song is unique as the song hasn't an ending (the song ended with "Zaijian Bu Zaijian", questioning herself again). On 1 October 2015, Shila performed her second Chinese single{{Cite web|url=http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/entertainment/art/20151002/19317040|title=馮仁昭四圍超：茜拉公開演奏練膽量|website=Apple Daily 蘋果日報|access-date=25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160323031830/http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/entertainment/art/20151002/19317040|archivedate=23 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite web|url=http://news.seehua.com/?p=98200|title=茜拉《再见》控前度|website=马来西亚诗华日报新闻网|access-date=25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160313012720/http://news.seehua.com/?p=98200|archivedate= 13 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} in Hong Kong, "Goodbye" (Chinese: '''再見'''){{Cite web|title = Shila reveals the next chapter in her love story in ‘Zaijian’ (再見)|url = http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/shila-reveals-the-next-chapter-in-her-love-story-in-zaijian-video|website = www.themalaymailonline.com|accessdate = 26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227033747/http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/shila-reveals-the-next-chapter-in-her-love-story-in-zaijian-video|archivedate =27 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} during her ''Shila Amzah Meet & Greet Hong Kong'' acoustically with a guitar''.''{{Cite web|url=http://paper.wenweipo.com/2015/10/02/EN1510020021.htm|title=茜拉首次來港會歌迷 - 香港文匯報|website=paper.wenweipo.com|access-date=25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304051345/http://paper.wenweipo.com/2015/10/02/EN1510020021.htm|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}} On 6 October 2015, Shila released the single through Shilala (HK) Limited on Weibo Music and iTunes.{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/zai-jian-guo-single/id1048561446|title=再見 (國) - Single by Shila Amzah on iTunes|website=iTunes|access-date=25 March 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171224213630/https://itunes.apple.com/my/album/zai-jian-guo-single/id1048561446|archivedate=24 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} The song was produced by Jun Kung and Kelvin Avon. The writers was inspired to write "Goodbye" after hearing Shila's previous single, which was "[[See You or Never (Shila Amzah song)|See You or Never]]".{{Cite web|title = 馮仁昭四圍超：茜拉公開演奏練膽量|url = http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/entertainment/art/20151002/19317040|website = Apple Daily 蘋果日報|accessdate = 26 December 2015|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151227013819/http://hk.apple.nextmedia.com/entertainment/art/20151002/19317040|archivedate = 27 December 2015|df = dmy-all}} The song contains Malaysian pop and Mandopop elements and its lyrics have Shila desiring an out-of-reach love interest. Shila said that this song has an English version of it that will be launched in her upcoming album. The single is a continuation from her previous Chinese hit, "Zaijian Bu Zaijian" (再見不再見), meaning "See You or Never".{{Cite web|title =茜拉《再见》控前度|url =http://www.news.seehua.com/?p=98200|website =诗华日报新闻网|accessdate =26 December 2015|deadurl =no|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20151226231145/http://www.news.seehua.com/?p=98200|archivedate =26 December 2015|df =dmy-all}} On 26 December 2015, Shila was named Metro Radio National Idol and received Metro Radio Mandarin Song of the Year for from the Metro Radio Music Awards for "[[Goodbye (Shila Amzah song)|Goodbye]]". On 12 February 2016, Shila visited [[Perth]] for her "Shila Amzah Colorful World 2016 Live in Perth". This concert was promoted by Aus World Travel and Chinatown Cinema. She performed her newest Chinese song, "Xiang Ai" from her debut Chinese-language album, ''My Journey''. On 26 February 2016, Shila was awarded "Outstanding Export Achievement Award" by the Malaysia External Trade Development Corporation (MATRADE) during the MATRADE Awards for her achievement promoting Malaysia at the international stages. In early 2016, [[Deputy prime minister|Deputy Prime Minister]] of Malaysia, [[Ahmad Zahid Hamidi|Datuk Seri Ahmad Zahid Hamidi]] announced during the 19th Tourism Malaysia Awards that Shila was appointed as [[Malaysia]]'s tourism ambassador.{{cite web|url=http://www.tourism.gov.my/media/view/shila-amzah-appointed-malaysia-s-tourism-ambassador-for-china|title=Shila Amzah Appointed Malaysia's Tourism Ambassador for China|date=1 March 2016|publisher=Tourism Malaysia|accessdate=16 December 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161208135408/http://www.tourism.gov.my/media/view/shila-amzah-appointed-malaysia-s-tourism-ambassador-for-china|archivedate=8 December 2016|df=dmy-all}} The Malaysian Government believes Shila could attract millions of visitors from mainland China to vacation in Malaysia. The fact that she speaks fluent Chinese will make it easier for her to deal with her music management and her Chinese fans.{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah Dilantik Duta Pelancongan Malaysia|url = http://www.mynewshub.cc/2016/02/18/shila-amzah-dilantik-duta-pelancongan-malaysia/|website = MyNewsHub|access-date = 18 February 2016|location = Malaysia|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160423192420/http://www.mynewshub.cc/2016/02/18/shila-amzah-dilantik-duta-pelancongan-malaysia/|archivedate = 23 April 2016|df = dmy-all}}{{Cite web|title = All systems go for visa waiver for China tourists:|url = http://www.dailyexpress.com.my/news.cfm?NewsID=106923|website = www.dailyexpress.com.my|access-date = 20 February 2016|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160220101113/http://www.dailyexpress.com.my/news.cfm?NewsID=106923|archivedate = 20 February 2016|df = dmy-all}} On 10 March 2016, ''Music Asia'' reported that Shila has her sights set on Taiwan music market.{{Cite news|url=https://www.music-asia.com/2016/03/shila-amzah-on-her-greater-china-story/|title=Shila Amzah on her Greater China story|date=10 March 2016|work=Music Asia|access-date=28 December 2017|language=en-US|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228232055/https://www.music-asia.com/2016/03/shila-amzah-on-her-greater-china-story/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} Shila said she had produced a song with [[Khalil Fong]] to release in Taiwan. On 13 March 2016, Malaysian Chinese newspaper ''Sinchew Daily'' reported that the album was 80% done, with a planned release in April 2016. On 1 April 2016, Shila released her debut Chinese microfilm titled "Girlfriends Love" (閨蜜情緣), in which she plays the lead.{{cite web|title=Shila Amzah set to debut her first Chinese ‘micro movie’|url=http://www.thehive.asia/2016/03/shila-amzah-set-to-debut-her-first.html|website=www.thehive.asia|accessdate= 1 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160402162520/http://www.thehive.asia/2016/03/shila-amzah-set-to-debut-her-first.html|archivedate=2 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} On 14 April 2016, Shila released the [[Theme music|theme song]] of the new series of ''[[The Powerpuff Girls (2016 TV series)|The Powerpuff Girls]]'' (2016), "Who's Got the Power?" in [[Malay language|Malay]] and [[Chinese language|Chinese]] exclusively on YouTube.{{cite web|title=Shila Amzah brings her voice to The Powerpuff Girls!|url=http://ramarama.my/shila-amzah-brings-voice-powerpuff-girls|website=www.ramarama.my|accessdate=14 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160414162547/http://ramarama.my/shila-amzah-brings-voice-powerpuff-girls/|archivedate=14 April 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.star2.com/entertainment/music/music-news/2016/04/16/shila-amzah-joins-forces-with-the-powerpuff-girls/|title=Shila Amzah joins forces with The Powerpuff Girls! - Star2.com|website=Star2.com|language=en-US|access-date=16 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160417165009/http://www.star2.com/entertainment/music/music-news/2016/04/16/shila-amzah-joins-forces-with-the-powerpuff-girls/|archivedate=17 April 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.lipstiq.com/2016/120251/malaysian-shila-amzah-to-sing-the-powerpuff-girls-theme-song|title=Malaysian Shila Amzah To Sing ‘The Powerpuff Girls’ Theme Song!|website=Lipstiq.com|language=en-US|access-date=16 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160420152815/http://www.lipstiq.com/2016/120251/malaysian-shila-amzah-to-sing-the-powerpuff-girls-theme-song|archivedate=20 April 2016|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite web|url=http://news.seehua.com/?p=160103|title=女汉子无爱一身轻　茜拉再见卸情伤|website=马来西亚诗华日报新闻网|access-date=16 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160415114158/http://news.seehua.com/?p=160103|archivedate=15 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} On 21 April 2016, Shila announced her debut Chinese album, ''[[My Journey (Shila Amzah album)|My Journey]]'' (Chinese: '''心旅''') on [[Instagram]], [[Twitter]] and [[Facebook]] simultaneously.{{Cite web|url=http://www.helloasia.com.au/news/shila-amzah-announces-upcoming-album-my-journey/|title=Shila Amzah announces upcoming album "My Journey" – Hello Asia!|website=Hello Asia!|language=en-AU|access-date=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228171728/http://www.helloasia.com.au/news/shila-amzah-announces-upcoming-album-my-journey/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} The album was released physically and digitally on 30 April 2016 through Shilala (HK) Limited and was launched in Beijing, China. The album's supporting world tour,{{Cite news|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/shila-amzah-to-kick-off-her-first-world-tour-in-malaysia#piFhxyKK6pwYckIc.97|title=Shila Amzah to kick off her first world tour in Malaysia|date=16 June 2017|access-date=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228181508/http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/shila-amzah-to-kick-off-her-first-world-tour-in-malaysia#piFhxyKK6pwYckIc.97|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} "Shila Amzah My Journey World Tour" was first held on 26 August 2017 in Arena of Stars, Genting Highland in Malaysia.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thehive.asia/2017/06/shila-amzah-to-kick-off-her-first-world.html|title=Shila Amzah to kick off her first world tour in Malaysia|last=TheHive|work=TheHive.Asia|access-date=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171016092154/http://www.thehive.asia/2017/06/shila-amzah-to-kick-off-her-first-world.html|archivedate=16 October 2017|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/07/17/from-china-to-penang-singer-shila-wows-her-fans/|title=From China to Penang, singer Shila wows her fans|last=|first=|date=|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228232146/https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/07/17/from-china-to-penang-singer-shila-wows-her-fans/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.nst.com.my/lifestyle/groove/2017/07/257808/popstar-shila-amzah-meets-penang-fans-ahead-genting-concert|title=Popstar Shila Amzah meets Penang fans ahead of Genting concert|date=16 July 2017|work=NST Online|access-date=28 December 2017|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228172329/https://www.nst.com.my/lifestyle/groove/2017/07/257808/popstar-shila-amzah-meets-penang-fans-ahead-genting-concert|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} The concert is the fifth full-fledged solo concert by Shila after the "Shila Amzah Colorful World Live in Perth" in Australia and the second full-fledged concert by her in Malaysia after the [[Shila Amzah Love Live in Malaysia Concert]] held in 13 September 2014. === 2017–present: Further international stardom === At a press conference on 27 December 2017, in Los Angeles, US, it was announced that Shila will released a new single written by a two-time Emmy award-winning composer, [[Nathan Wang]] titled "Rising Above"{{Cite web|url=http://www.chinesetoday.com/big/article/1214287|title=茜拉演繹《自強不息》 歌詞反映美國華人奮鬥精神|website=www.chinesetoday.com|access-date=28 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228172554/http://www.chinesetoday.com/big/article/1214287|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} in the US in conjunction of the Rose Parade in Pasedana, [[California]]. The song was recorded in English and Mandarin in Burbank, California.{{Cite news|url=https://tw.appledaily.com/new/realtime/20171228/1267677/|title=【LA獨家】絕密錄音室片曝光！大馬茜拉飆高音唱玫瑰花車歌 {{!}} 蘋果日報|work=蘋果日報|access-date=28 December 2017|language=zh-TW|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171228171837/https://tw.appledaily.com/new/realtime/20171228/1267677/|archivedate=28 December 2017|df=dmy-all}} On 16 April 2018, Shila released "If We Are Getting Old" (Chinese: '''如果我们老了''') as the lead single of her upcoming seventh overall and second debut Chinese-language studio album through Star Culture Media. It was released ahead of her solemnization ceremony with her current husband, Haris Idraki Elias. She performed the lead single live during Global Chinese Music Chart and also during her reception wedding held in Putrajaya, Malaysia. On 10 May 2018, Shila released the second single "Love Planet" (Chinese: '''涂爱星球''') of her upcoming album through Star Culture Media. On 12 June 2018, Shila released the third single "My Dear" (Chinese: '''我的他''') of her seventh studio album through Star Culture Media. It was composed by Shila herself. == Official brand: SA by Shila Amzah == On 5 June 2016, Shila launched her own clothing line and her exclusive boutique called SA by Shila Amzah Boutique located at [[Bangi, Malaysia|Bangi]] Sentral, [[Selangor]], Malaysia. == Awards and nominations == === 2013: International Breakthrough Award === At the 20th Malaysian Music Awards, Shila received the '''Anugerah Kembara''' (''International Breakthrough Award''). The award is given to Malaysian artists who have performed internationally and introduced Malaysians song to the world. Shila Amzah was given this award after she rose to fame as the champion of ''Asian Wave'' (2012), a reality Chinese singing competition held in Shanghai, China. === 2014: Puteri UMNO Female Icon Award === At the ''Perhimpunan Agung UMNO'' (UMNO General Assembly) 2014, she received the ''Puteri UMNO Female Icon Award''.{{cite web|url = http://english.astroawani.com/news/show/shila-amzah-fatehah-mustafa-among-puteri-umno-female-icon-award-recipients-49220|title = Shila Amzah, Fatehah Mustafa among Puteri UMNO Female Icon Award recipients|author = |date = |work = astroawani.com|accessdate = 25 October 2015}}{{Cite web|title = Shila Amzah Terima Anugerah Ikon Wanita Muda 2014|url = http://bm.therakyatpost.com/berita/2014/11/26/shila-amzah-terima-anugerah-ikon-wanita-muda-2014/|website = The Rakyat Post|access-date = 11 January 2016|language = ms-MY|deadurl = no|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160324214053/http://bm.therakyatpost.com/berita/2014/11/26/shila-amzah-terima-anugerah-ikon-wanita-muda-2014/|archivedate = 24 March 2016|df = dmy-all}} {{Main|List of awards and nominations received by Shila Amzah}} {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year !Competition/Association !Category/Award !Nominated work !Result !Host Country |- | rowspan=2|2000 |''Bintang Kecil RTM'' |2nd place |"Ibu" |{{Won}}

{{Other uses|Sleepy Hollow (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Sleepy Hollow, New York |settlement_type = [[Village (New York)|Village]] |nickname = |motto =
<!-- Images --> |image_skyline = Tarrytown Old Dutch Church crop.JPG |imagesize = 250px |image_caption = The [[Old Dutch Church of Sleepy Hollow|Old Dutch Church]] in 1907 |image_flag = |image_seal =
<!-- Maps --> |image_map = Westchester County New York incorporated and unincorporated areas Sleepy Hollow highlighted.svg |map_caption = Location of Sleepy Hollow, New York
<!-- Location --> |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = United States |subdivision_type1 = [[U.S. state|State]] |subdivision_name1 = [[New York (state)|New York]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of counties in New York|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Westchester County, New York|Westchester]] |subdivision_type3 = [[Municipalities in Westchester County|Town]] |subdivision_name3 = [[Mount Pleasant, New York|Mount Pleasant]] |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |established_title = |established_date =
<!-- Area --> |unit_pref = Imperial |area_footnotes = |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 13.2 |area_land_km2 = 5.9 |area_water_km2 = 7.3 |area_total_sq_mi = 5.1 |area_land_sq_mi = 2.3 |area_water_sq_mi = 2.8
<!-- Population --> |population_as_of = [[2010 United States Census|2010]] |population_footnotes = |population_total = 9870 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_density_sq_mi = auto
<!-- General information --> |timezone = [[Eastern Time Zone|Eastern (EST)]] |utc_offset = -5 |timezone_DST = EDT |utc_offset_DST = -4 |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = 27 |elevation_ft = 89 |coordinates = {{coord|41|5|31|N|73|51|52|W|region:US-NY|display=inline,title}} |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 10591 |area_code = [[Area code 914|914]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 36-67638 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0958934 |website = |footnotes = |pop_est_as_of = 2016 |pop_est_footnotes = <ref name="USCensusEst2016"/> |population_est = 10198 }} '''Sleepy Hollow''' is a village in the town of [[Mount Pleasant, New York|Mount Pleasant]], in [[Westchester County, New York]]. The village is located on the east bank of the [[Hudson River]], about {{convert|30|mi}} north of [[New York City]], and is served by the [[Philipse Manor (Metro-North station)|Philipse Manor]] stop on the [[Metro-North]] [[Hudson Line (Metro-North)|Hudson Line]]. To the south of Sleepy Hollow is the village of [[Tarrytown, New York|Tarrytown]], and to the north and east are unincorporated parts of Mount Pleasant. The population of the village at the 2010 census was 9,870.<ref name="Census 2010">{{cite web| url=http://factfinder2.census.gov| title=Profile of General Population and Housing Characteristics: 2010 Demographic Profile Data (DP-1): Sleepy Hollow village, New York| website=U.S. Census Bureau, American Factfinder| accessdate=November 18, 2011}}</ref>
Originally incorporated as '''North Tarrytown''' in the late 19th century, in 1996 the village officially adopted the traditional name for the area.<ref>{{cite news |title=North Tarrytown Votes to Pursue Its Future as Sleepy Hollow |first=Joseph |last=Berger |authorlink=Joseph Berger (author) |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/12/11/nyregion/north-tarrytown-votes-to-pursue-its-future-as-sleepy-hollow.html |newspaper=The New York Times |date=December 11, 1996 |accessdate=November 18, 2011}}</ref> The village is known to many via "[[The Legend of Sleepy Hollow]]", a short story about the local area and its infamous specter, the [[Headless Horseman]], written by [[Washington Irving]], who lived in Tarrytown and is buried in [[Sleepy Hollow Cemetery]]. Owing to this story, as well as the village's roots in early American history and folklore, Sleepy Hollow is considered by some to be one of the "most haunted places in the world".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Hoeller|first1=Sophie-Claire|title=The 6 Most Haunted Towns in the World|url=http://www.thrillist.com/travel/nation/haunted-towns-around-the-world-the-creepiest-towns-full-of-ghosts|website=Thrillist|date=October 28, 2014|accessdate=July 31, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Summers|first1=Ken|title=Phantom Ships, Headless Skeletons, and Weeping Spirits: Investigating the Real Ghosts of New York’s Sleepy Hollow|url=http://weekinweird.com/2014/10/13/real-ghosts-sleepy-hollow/|website=Week In Weird|accessdate=July 31, 2015|date=October 13, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The Sleepy Hollow Hauntings|url=http://www.haunted-places-to-go.com/sleepy-hollow.html|website=Haunted Places to Go|accessdate=July 31, 2015}}</ref>
The village is home to the [[Philipsburg Manor House]] and the [[Old Dutch Church of Sleepy Hollow]], as well as the [[Sleepy Hollow Cemetery]], where in addition to [[Washington Irving]], numerous [[Sleepy Hollow Cemetery#Notable burials|other notable people]] are buried.
==History== [[File:Philipsburg Manor, Sleepy Hollow, New York.JPG|thumb|left|[[Philipsburg Manor House]] at the Upper Mills]] The land that would become Sleepy Hollow was first bought from [[Adriaen van der Donck]], a [[patroon]] in [[New Netherland]] before the English takeover in 1664. Starting in 1672 [[Frederick Philipse]] began acquiring large parcels of land mainly in today's southern Westchester County. Comprising some {{convert|52000|acre|sqmi}} of land, it was bounded by the [[Spuyten Duyvil Creek]], the [[Croton River]], the [[Hudson River]], and the [[Bronx River]]. Philipse was granted a royal charter in 1693, creating the [[Manor of Philipsburg]] and establishing him as first lord.<ref>{{cite encyclopedia |last=Eisenstadt |first=Peter |encyclopedia=Encyclopedia of the State of New York |title=New York State: An Introduction |edition=First |year=2005 |publisher=[[Syracuse University Press]] |location=[[Syracuse, New York]] |isbn=0-8156-0808-X |pages=1199}}</ref>
In today's Sleepy Hollow he established an upper mill and shipping depot, today part of the [[Philipse Manor House]] historic site. A pious man, he was architect and financier of the town's [[Old Dutch Church of Sleepy Hollow|Old Dutch Church]], said also to have built the pulpit with his own hands.<ref>''Edited Appletons Encyclopedia, Famous Americans'': Biography of Frederick Philipse: "...He worked at the carpenter's trade for several years, aided in building the Old Dutch church, and is said to have made the pulpit with his own hands.</ref>
When Philipse died in 1702, the manor was divided between his son, [[Adolphus Philipse]], and his grandson, [[Frederick Philipse II]]. Adolph received the Upper Mills property, which extended from [[Dobbs Ferry, New York|Dobbs Ferry]] to the Croton River. Frederick II was given the Lower Mills at the confluence of the [[Saw Mill River|Saw Mill]] and Hudson Rivers, the two parcels being reunited on his uncle's death. His son, [[Frederick Philipse III|Frederick III]], became the third lord of the manor in 1751.<ref name=encyclopedia>{{cite encyclopedia |last=Maika |first=Dennis J. |editor=Peter Eisenstadt |encyclopedia=Encyclopedia of the State of New York |title=Philipsburg Manor |edition=First |year=2005 |publisher=[[Syracuse University Press]] |location=[[Syracuse, New York]] |isbn=0-8156-0808-X |pages=1199}}</ref>
In 1779, Frederick Philipse III, a [[Loyalist (American Revolution)|Loyalist]], was [[Bill of attainder|attained]] for treason, The manor was confiscated and sold at [[public auction]], split between 287 buyers. The largest tract of land (about {{convert|750|acre|ha}}) was at the Upper Mills; it passed to numerous owners until 1951, when it was acquired by [[Historic Hudson Valley|Sleepy Hollow Restorations]]. Thanks to the philanthropy of [[John D. Rockefeller Jr.]], about {{convert|20|acre|ha}} were restored as today's historic site.<ref name=encyclopedia/>
==Geography== Sleepy Hollow is located at {{Coord|41|5|31|N|73|51|52|W|type:city}} (41.091998, −73.864361).<ref name="GR1">{{cite web|url=https://www.census.gov/geo/www/gazetteer/gazette.html|publisher=[[United States Census Bureau]]|accessdate=2011-04-23|date=2011-02-12|title=US Gazetteer files: 2010, 2000, and 1990}}</ref> According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the village has a total area of {{convert|5.1|sqmi|km2}}, of which {{convert|2.3|sqmi|km2}} is land and {{convert|2.8|sqmi|km2}}, or 55.58%, is water.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://censusviewer.com/city/NY/Sleepy%20Hollow |title=Sleepy Hollow, NY Population - Census 2010 and 2000 Interactive Map, Demographics, Statistics, Quick Facts |publisher=CensusViewer |date= |accessdate=2017-05-12}}</ref>
==Demographics== {{US Census population |1880= 2684 |1890= 3179 |1900= 4241 |1910= 5421 |1920= 5927 |1930= 7417 |1940= 8804 |1950= 8740 |1960= 8818 |1970= 8334 |1980= 7994 |1990= 8152 |2000= 9212 |2010= 9870 |estyear=2016 |estimate=10198 |estref=<ref name="USCensusEst2016">{{cite web|url=https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/data/tables.2016.html|title=Population and Housing Unit Estimates|accessdate=June 9, 2017}}</ref> |footnote=U.S. Decennial Census<ref name="DecennialCensus">{{cite web|url=https://www.census.gov/prod/www/decennial.html|title=Census of Population and Housing|publisher=Census.gov|accessdate=June 4, 2015}}</ref> }} As of the census<ref name="GR2">{{cite web|url=http://factfinder2.census.gov|publisher=[[United States Census Bureau]]|accessdate=2008-01-31|title=American FactFinder}}</ref> of 2010, there were 9,870 people, 3,181 households, and 2,239 families residing in the village. The population density was 4,054.7 people per square mile (1,566.9/km²). There were 3,253 housing units at an average density of 1,431.8 per square mile (553.3/km²). The racial makeup of the village was 61.01% [[Caucasian race|Caucasian]], 6.21% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.83% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 3.25% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.01% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 23.47% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 5.22% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 51.04% of the population, many of whom are [[Ecuadorian American|Ecuadorian]], [[Dominican American|Dominican]], [[Chilean American|Chilean]], and [[Puerto Rican American|Puerto Rican]].
There were 3,181 households out of which 36.0% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 51.5% were married couples living together, 13.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 29.6% were non-families. 23.0% of all households were made up of individuals and 8.7% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.89 and the average family size was 3.37.
In the village, the population was spread out with 25.0% under the age of 18, 8.9% from 18 to 24, 36.7% from 25 to 44, 18.9% from 45 to 64, and 10.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 34 years. For every 100 females, there were 103.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 101.9 males.
The median income for a household in the village was $54,201, and the median income for a family was $63,889. Males had a median income of $39,923 versus $32,146 for females. The per capita income for the village was $28,325. About 5.7% of families and 7.4% of the population were below the poverty line, including 9.3% of those under age 18 and 7.9% of those age 65 or over.
==Notable landmarks== [[File:Edward Harden Mansion, Sleepy Hollow, NY.jpg|thumb|left|[[Edward Harden Mansion]]]] The [[Edward Harden Mansion]], now serving as the administration building for the Public Schools of the Tarrytowns, [[Patriot's Park]], [[Philipse Manor (Metro-North station)|Philipse Manor Railroad Station]], Sleepy Hollow Cemetery, and the [[Tarrytown Light]] are listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]]. The [[Old Dutch Church of Sleepy Hollow]] and [[Philipsburg Manor House]] are listed as [[National Historic Landmark]]s.<ref name="nris">{{NRISref|version=2009a}}</ref> Also of note are Kingsland Point Park, Philipse Manor Beach Club, and the [[Rockefeller State Park Preserve]].
In 2017, former [[FDNY]] fireboat [[John D. McKean (fireboat)|''John D. McKean'']] will be opened as a floating museum, near [[Tarrytown Light]]house.<ref name=NYPost2016-10-23> {{cite news |url = https://nypost.com/2016/10/23/how-an-fdny-boat-that-rescued-911-survivors-lives-on/ |title = How an FDNY boat that rescued 9/11 survivors lives on |work = [[New York Post]] |author = Dawson, Mackenzie |date = October 23, 2016 |page = |location = |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20161024195731/http://nypost.com/2016/10/23/how-an-fdny-boat-that-rescued-911-survivors-lives-on/ |archivedate = October 24, 2016 |deadurl = yes |quote = He plans to soon open the boat — which was built in Camden, NJ, at a reported cost of $1.4 million — to the public as a sort of museum. It will be in good company; the vessel will be docked just north of the Tarrytown Lighthouse, which is on the National Register of Historic Places. |df = mdy-all }} </ref>
==Emergency services== [[File:SHFD1.jpg|thumb|One of the three fire engines during a parade in nearby [[Pleasantville, New York|Pleasantville]]]] {{As of|2014}}, the village's police department had 27 officers, four school crossing guards, and three civilian employees.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sleepyhollowny.gov/police-department|title=Police Department|website=Village of Sleepy Hollow|accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref> The village is also served by the [[New York State Police]] and [[Westchester County Department of Public Safety]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altmanlawoffice.com/lawyer-attorney-1879261.html|title=Sleepy Hollow Village Court|website=Law Office of Jared Altman|accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref> Police officers from the villages of Sleepy Hollow and [[Dobbs Ferry]], the town of [[Greenburgh]], and the New York State Police make up a Marine / H.E.A.T. Unit.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greenburghny.com/cit-e-access/webpage.cfm?TID=10&TPID=2874|title=Special Operations Unit|website=Greenburgh Police Department |accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref> As of 2006, police base salaries in Sleepy Hollow were low compared to other Westchester County forces, in part due to the lower tax base.<ref>{{cite journal|title=What's Fair and What's Enough..., Negotiating A New Police Contract|author=Robert Bonvento|date=2006-07-28|url=http://www.riverjournalonline.com/villages/sleepyhollow/358-Whats-Fair-and-Whats-Enough....html|journal=River Journal|accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref>
The Sleepy Hollow Fire Patrol, now the Sleepy Hollow Fire Department, was organized in 1876 and within 25 years had grown to five companies in three fire stations. As of 2012, there were three engines, two boats, and one tower ladder, as well as other equipment. The fire department is run by volunteers and responds to over 300 calls each year. The local hospital, [[Phelps Memorial Hospital|Phelps Memorial]], responds to hundreds of emergencies per year.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://knowtorious.webfactional.com/node/2971|title=Sleepy Hollow Firefighters Well Equipped to Protect Village|journal=The Hudson Independent|author=Janie Rosman |date=2012-07-07|accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref>
[[Emergency medical services]] in Sleepy Hollow depend on volunteers assisted by paid staff. The Ambulance Corps has two basic life support ambulances. Mount Pleasant Paramedics provides advanced life support.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sleepyhollowny.gov/ambulance-corp|title=Ambulance Corp|website=Village of Sleepy Hollow |accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref>
==In popular culture== Sleepy Hollow has been used as a setting or filming location for numerous media works, including films, games, literature, motion pictures, and television productions, including: ;Literature * Sleepy Hollow is the setting of [[Washington Irving]]'s short story "[[The Legend of Sleepy Hollow]]" (1820) and its many adaptations in other media
;Films * ''[[The Curse of the Cat People]]'' (1944) * ''[[The Scarlet Coat]]'' (1955), partially about [[American Revolutionary War]] general [[Benedict Arnold]]'s associate [[John Andre]]'s real-life capture in the village * the film adaptation of the ''[[Dark Shadows]]'' television series, ''[[House of Dark Shadows]]'' (1970) * [[Woody Allen]]'s film ''[[Mighty Aphrodite]]'' (1995) * [[Sidney Lumet]]'s film remake ''[[Gloria (1999 American film)|Gloria]]'' (1999) * the film remake ''[[The Thomas Crown Affair (1999 film)|The Thomas Crown Affair]]'' (1999) * [[Tim Burton]]'s ''[[Sleepy Hollow (film)|Sleepy Hollow]]'' (1999), made primarily in England * the film ''[[The Family Man]]'' (2000) * the film ''[[Super Troopers]]'' (2003) * the film ''[[Lord of War]]'' (2005) * [[Robert De Niro]]'s film ''[[The Good Shepherd (film)|The Good Shepherd]]'' (2006) * the film ''[[Why Stop Now (film)|Why Stop Now]]'' (2012) * the film ''[[The English Teacher (film)|The English Teacher]]'' (2013) * the [[Stephen King]] film adaptation ''[[A Good Marriage (film)|A Good Marriage]]'' (2014)<ref>{{cite web|title=Stephen King's 'A Good Marriage' Filming in Sleepy Hollow, NY This Month |url=http://www.onlocationvacations.com/2013/05/20/stephen-kings-a-good-marriage-filming-in-sleepy-hollow-ny-this-month/|website=OnLocationVacations.com|date=May 20, 2013}}</ref> * the film adaptation ''[[The Girl on the Train (2016 film)|The Girl on the Train]]'' (2016) * the film ''[[The Meyerowitz Stories]]'' (2017), filmed primarily in and around [[Northwell Health]]'s [[Phelps Memorial Hospital|Phelps Memorial Hospital Center]] * the film ''[[Wonderstruck (film)|Wonderstruck]]'' (2017)
;Games * Sleepy Hollow is a location in the game ''[[Assassin's Creed Rogue]]'' (2014)
;Television * The four-season television series ''[[Sleepy Hollow (TV series)|Sleepy Hollow]]'', though set in and around the village through the centuries, greatly expanded its population to 144,000, as indicated by a sign at the beginning of the pilot episode, though several aerial shots of the actual village are incorporated into the series * Television personality and activist [[Caitlyn Jenner]], a Sleepy Hollow High School alumnus, led TV journalist [[Diane Sawyer]] on a tour of the village and neighboring Tarrytown during her 2015 interview on ''[[20/20 (U.S. TV series)|20/20]]'' Television shot on location in Sleepy Hollow includes: * the "Tale of the Midnight Ride" episode of the television series ''[[Are You Afraid of the Dark?]]'' * an episode of the television series ''[[Property Brothers]]'' during its Westchester-dedicated season * the television series ''[[Divorce (TV series)|Divorce]]'' starring [[Sarah Jessica Parker]] * the "Two Boats and a Helicopter" episode of the television series ''[[The Leftovers (TV series)|The Leftovers]]'' * the television series ''[[Sneaky Pete]]'' * the television series [[The Path (TV series)|''The Path'']] * an episode of the television series ''[[Man v. Food]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lohud.com/story/life/food/2017/08/15/hit-series-man-vs-food-takes-westchester/567973001/|title=Hit series 'Man v. Food' takes on Westchester|website=Lohud.com|accessdate=October 14, 2017}}</ref> * the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] miniseries ''[[Escape at Dannemora]]'' * the television series ''[[Pose (TV series)|Pose]]'' * the [[Netflix]] revival of the series ''[[Tales_of_the_City_(2019_miniseries)|Tales of the City]]''
==Notable people== * [[Guy Adami]], professional investor, trader and television personality * [[Bob Akin]] (March 6, 1936 – April 29, 2002), business executive, journalist, television commentator and champion sports car racing driver * [[Dave Anthony]], stand-up comedian, writer, actor and podcaster * [[Fay Baker]] (January 31, 1917 – December 8, 1987), actress and author * [[Clarence Clough Buel]] (July 29, 1850 – May 22, 1933), United States editor and author * [[Keith Hamilton Cobb]], actor best known for ''[[The Young and the Restless]]'' * [[Abraham de Revier Sr.]] ({{circa|1650}} – {{circa|1720}}), early American historian and elder of the Old Dutch Church of Sleepy Hollow * [[Vincent Desiderio]], realist painter * [[Karen Finley]], performance artist * [[John C. Frémont]] (January 21, 1813 – July 13, 1890), American military officer, explorer, and politician who became the first candidate of the anti-slavery [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] for the office of [[President of the United States]] * [[Margaret Hardenbroeck]] ({{circa|1637}} – {{circa|1690}}), merchant in colonial New York and wife of Frederick Philipse, Lord of Philipse Manor * [[Elsie Janis]] (March 16, 1889 – February 26, 1956), singer, songwriter, actress, and screenwriter * [[Tom Keene (actor)|Tom Keene]] (December 30, 1896 – August 4, 1963), actor best known for [[King Vidor]]'s film classic ''[[Our Daily Bread (1934 film)|Our Daily Bread]]'' and [[Ed Wood]]'s film ''[[Plan 9 from Outer Space]]'' * [[Ambrose Kingsland]] (May 24, 1804 – October 13, 1878), wealthy merchant and mayor of New York City * [[Karl Knortz]] (August 28, 1841 – July 27, 1918), German-American author and champion of [[American literature]] * [[Joseph L. Levesque]], former President of [[Niagara University]] * [[Joan Lorring]] (April 17, 1926 – May 30, 2014), [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress|Academy Award]]-nominated actress and singer * [[Ted Mack (radio-TV host)|Ted Mack]] (February 12, 1904 – July 12, 1976), radio and television host best known for ''[[The Original Amateur Hour]]'' * [[Ralph G. Martin]] (March 4, 1920 – January 9, 2013), author and journalist * [[Frank Murphy (baseball)|Frank Murphy]] (April 6, 1876 - November 4, 1912), [[Major League Baseball]] player * [[Frederick Philipse]] ({{circa|1626}} – December 23, 1702), Lord of the [[Philipsburg Manor|Manor of Philipseborough (Philipsburg)]] * [[Adam Savage]], co-host of the television show ''[[MythBusters]]'' * [[Dirck Storm]] (1630–1716), early colonial American known for the ''[[Het Notite Boeck der Christelyckes Kercke op de Manner of Philips Burgh|Het Notite Boeck]]'' record of Dutch village life in New York * [[Worcester Reed Warner]] (May 16, 1846 – June 25, 1929), mechanical engineer, entrepreneur, manager, astronomer, and philanthropist * [[James Watson Webb|General James Watson Webb]] (February 8, 1802 – June 7, 1884), United States diplomat, newspaper publisher, and New York politician

revision.comment: Added reference to the establishment of the Australian Financial Complaints Authority
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{Use Australian English|date=January 2012}} The '''Superannuation Complaints Tribunal''' is an independent statutory body established by the [[Australian Government]] to deal with complaints about superannuation (and certain life insurance annuities).
== History==
The Superannuation Complaints Tribunal was established under the Superannuation (Resolution of Complaints) Act in 1993. It was established at the same time as a new prudential and disclosure framework was put in place under the Superannuation Industry (Supervision) Act 1993, protecting employees compulsory superannuation contributions (introduced in 1992).
==Operation of the Tribunal==
In order for the Tribunal to deal with a complaint, a member (former member or potential beneficiary) of a superannuation fund must first make a formal complaint to the Trustee of that fund (under the fund's own internal complaints procedures). If the complaint is not resolved to the member's satisfaction (or has not been dealt with within a 90-day period) then a complaint can be made to the Tribunal.
The Tribunal will only deal with complaints as they relate to a trustee decision affecting an individual member. The Tribunal cannot deal with complaints about the fund as a whole (e.g. poor investment performance). [http://www.sct.gov.au/Making_a_complaint/default.asp?images=b]
The Tribunal will first try and resolve the complaint through conciliation (where the SCT will facilitate a discussion with all parties involved).
If conciliation is not successful, the Tribunal will make a "review" decision that is binding on all parties.
From July 1, 2018, the Australian Financial Complaints Authority (AFCA) will replace the Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS), the Superannuation Complaints Tribunal (SCT) and the Credit and Investments Ombudsman.
== See also== *[[Superannuation in Australia]] *[[Australian Prudential Regulation Authority]] *[[Australian Securities and Investments Commission]] *[[Ombudsmen in Australia]] *[[Financial Ombudsman Service (Australia)]]
==References== * [http://www.fido.gov.au/asic/pdflib.nsf/LookupByFileName/You_can_complain_Eng.pdf/$file/You_can_complain_Eng.pdf "You can complain"] by [[Australian Securities and Investments Commission]]'', June, 2006, retrieved 29 December 2006 * [http://www.aph.gov.au/senate/committee/history/super_ctte/suprep18/index.htm "Review of the Superannuation Complaints Tribunal"] by the Senate Select Committee on Superannuation, April 1996
== External links== * Superannaution Complaints Tribunal Website http://www.sct.gov.au/ * ASIC Consumer Website "MoneySmart" http://www.moneysmart.gov.au

{{unreferenced|date=January 2014}} '''The Wall Street Journal Special Editions''' is a venture launched in 1994 by ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'' to expand its readership abroad, especially in the [[Americas]]. It publishes pages, bearing the ''Journal's'' banner, within major daily and weekly newspapers around the world featuring selected content from ''The Wall Street Journal''. Its Special Editions are carried in 37 newspapers in 35 countries, translated into 10 languages, with a total combined circulation of 5.2 million. '''''The Wall Street Journal Americas''''' is the Special Editions' centerpiece, published in [[Spanish language|Spanish]] and [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] in 18 [[Latin America]]n nations. ==Full List of Wall Street Journal Special Editions== ===Wall Street Journal Americas=== :''(note: the following figures are correct as of December 2004)'' {| class="wikitable" |- ! revision.comment: Robot - Removing category Dutch people of Huguenot descent per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 September 27]].
revision.text:
'''Theophilus Cazenove''', or '''Theophile Cazenove''' (13 October 1740 – 6 March 1811), was a Dutch financier and one of the agents of the [[Holland Land Company]].
== Life and career ==
Theophilus Cazenove was born in [[Amsterdam]] on 13 October 1740, as the son of Théophile Cazenove and Marie de Rapin-Thoyras, French/Swiss [[Huguenots]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://huguenot-manakin.org/manakin/brock1.php|title=Huguenot Society FMCV - Documents relating to the Hugenot Emigration|work=huguenot-manakin.org}}</ref> His father was a merchant and banker in Bordeaux, Saint Petersburg, [[Archangelsk]], Stockholm and the West-Indies; in 1759 he lost four ships loaded with sugar and coffee, which were taken by a Bristol [[privateer]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=L7QPAAAAQAAJ&pg=PA925 |title=Miscellaneous Correspondence, Containing a Variety of Subjects, Relative to Natural and Civil History, Geography, Mathematics, Poetry, Memoirs of Monthly Occurrences, Catalogues of New Books, &c. |first=Benjamin |last=Martin |date=1759 |page=925}}</ref> In 1760 the elder Théophile gave up his business and his sons Charles and Theophile assumed control of the company. In 1763, Theophile married Margaretha Helena van Jever, the daughter of a tradesman in Russia, and a member of the [[vroedschap]]. Cazenove spent his early career in commercial transactions in France and Russia, but went broke in 1770. In the same year, his portrait was painted by [[Jean-Baptiste Perronneau]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://collections.bm-lyon.fr/BML_01ICO001014cd411e7e7d29?&query[]=subject:%22Mus%C3%A9e%20lyonnais%20des%20arts%20d%C3%A9coratifs%20%28Lyon%29%22&hitStart=13&hitTotal=14&hitPageSize=16|title=Photographes en Rhône-Alpes::Chambre de Commerce de Lyon ; Musée des Arts décoratifs : J. -B. Perronneau, 1715-1783 ; Portrait au pastel de Théophile de Cazenove.|work=bm-lyon.fr}}</ref><ref>http://www.pastellists.com/Genealogies/Cazenove.pdf</ref> After the death of his father-in-law he was involved in a [[plantation]] in [[Surinam]]. In 1788 he collaborated with [[Étienne Clavière]] and [[Jacques Pierre Brissot]], who both traveled to the United States.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Warville|first1=Jacques-Pierre Brissot de|last2=Clavière|first2=Étienne|title=New Travels in the United States of America: Including The Commerce of America with Europe; Particularly with France and Great Britain. In Two Volumes|date=1994|publisher=J.S. Jordan|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=nbUVAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA149 |page=149}}</ref>
In November 1789 Cazenove was retained by [[Wilheim Willink|Pieter Stadnitski]] to travel to the United States to act as an investment agent for Stadnitski and other Dutch investors ([[Nicolaas van Staphorst|Nicolaas and Jacob Van Staphorst]], Pieter & Christiaen [[Van Eeghen]], and Ten Cate & Vollenhoven).<ref>http://stadsarchief.amsterdam.nl/archieven/archiefbank/overzicht/333.nl.html</ref><ref>http://www.onserfdeel.be/nl/uit_archief_detail.asp?artikel_id=14060</ref> Casenove settled in at [[Market Street (Philadelphia)|Market Street]] in [[Philadelphia]], where he dealt with financier [[Robert Morris (financier)|Robert Morris]]; his fellow traveller [[Gerrit Boon]] later went north. Boon believed that harvesting [[maple syrup]] could be a year-round activity, so slavery on the [[sugarcane]] [[Sugar plantations in the Caribbean|plantation]]s could be avoided.
In 1792 Cazenove invested his clients' money in development bonds issued by the new states and the federal government, after [[Alexander Hamilton]] promised to fully pay the debt. Another venture included investing in large tracts of undeveloped land in [[Genesee County, New York]], which included the [[Holland Purchase]].<ref>{{cite book |title=The Great American Land Bubble |date=1966 |publisher=Ludwig von Mises Institute |isbn=9781610162982 |page=61 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TYBKl5rM2O8C&pg=PA61}}</ref> In order to implement these large and difficult purchases (sometimes complicated by the claims of Native Americans), he employed the advisory services of Hamilton and later [[Aaron Burr]].
Cazenove lived well as a "grand seigneur" and was known for his extreme carelessness.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~nyccazen/Biographies/CazenoveT.html|title=Theophilus Cazenove Biography|work=ancestry.com}}</ref> His business dealings in maple syrup and canals were not particularly successful and the investors barely made any profit, even losing money in the Pennsylvania land dealings which he organized with [[James Wilson]]. He was also hard pressed to account for funds that were under his control. During this period he helped [[Antoine Charles Cazenove|his cousin]] from Geneva to settle in Philadelphia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://beta.worldcat.org/archivegrid/record.php?id=122503768&contributor=246&archivename=Winterthur+Museum%2C+Garden%2C+and+Library|title=ArchiveGrid : Papers, 1791-1852,.|work=worldcat.org|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402173505/http://beta.worldcat.org/archivegrid/record.php?id=122503768&contributor=246&archivename=Winterthur+Museum%2C+Garden%2C+and+Library|archivedate=2015-04-02|df=}}</ref> [[Alexander Baring (writer)|Alexander Baring]] wrote: "Cazenove is a sad dirty fellow and does all the mischief he can."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dbnl.org/tekst/_bij005196001_01/_bij005196001_01_0003.php|title=Bijdragen en Mededelingen van het Historisch Genootschap|volume= 75 |work=dbnl.org}}</ref> In 1798 he hired [[Joseph Ellicott]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.buffaloah.com/h/1799|title=Buffalo 1600-1799|work=buffaloah.com}}</ref> but [[Paolo Busti]] became his successor.
Although he became an American citizen in 1794, Cazenove returned to Europe in 1799. In Amsterdam he began to archive purchase of land for the financiers. He left the employment of the Dutch investors in 1802 and sought a position under [[Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord]], who he had met in Philadelphia in 1795, when also Talleyrand invested in land purchase.<ref name="archive.org">{{cite web|url=https://archive.org/stream/cazenovejournal101caze/cazenovejournal101caze_djvu.txt|title=Full text of "Cazenove journal, 1794 : a record of the journey of Theophile Cazenove through New Jersey and Pennsylvania"|work=archive.org}}</ref> Cazenove died in Paris in the [[Rue du Bac]].<ref name="archive.org"/>
His correspondence along with the records of the Holland Land Company are held in the [[Amsterdam City Archives]].
== Legacy == A number of places in New York are named after him, including the [[Cazenovia (village), New York|Village of Cazenovia]], [[Cazenovia (town), New York|Town of Cazenovia]], [[Cazenovia College]], [[Cazenovia Lake]], and [[Cazenovia Creek]].
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Cazenove, Theophilus}} [[Category:1740 births]] [[Category:1811 deaths]] [[Category:Dutch businesspeople]] [[Category:Dutch emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Amsterdam]] [[Category:Cazenovia, New York]]

{{Infobox Officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Thomas F. Bayard Jr. | honorific-suffix = | image = Thomas F. Bayard, Jr.jpg | imagesize = | smallimage = | office = [[United States Senate|United States Senator]]
from [[Delaware]] | term_start = November 8, 1922 | term_end = March 3, 1929 | predecessor = [[T. Coleman du Pont]] | successor = [[John G. Townsend Jr.]] |birth_name=Thomas Francis Bayard Jr. | birth_date = {{birth date|1868|6|4}} | birth_place = [[Wilmington, Delaware]], U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|1942|7|12|1868|6|4}} | death_place = [[Wilmington, Delaware]], U.S. | spouse = Elizabeth Bradford du Pont (m. 1908) | children = | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] | residence = [[Wilmington, Delaware]], U.S. | alma_mater = [[Yale University]] | occupation = | profession = lawyer }} '''Thomas Francis Bayard Jr.''' (June 4, 1868 – July 12, 1942) was an American lawyer and politician from [[Wilmington, Delaware]]. He was a Democratic U.S. Senator from Delaware in the 1920s. ==Early life and family== {{see also|Bayard family}} Bayard was born in Wilmington, Delaware, son of U.S. Senator [[Thomas F. Bayard|Thomas F. Bayard Sr.]] and grandson of U.S. Senator [[James A. Bayard Jr.]] In 1908, he married Elizabeth Bradford [[Du Pont family|du Pont]], and they had five children, Elizabeth, Thomas, Ellen, James, and [[Alexis I. du Pont Bayard|Alexis]]. They were members of the Episcopal Church. Bayard graduated from [[Yale University]] in 1890, where he was a member of [[Skull and Bones]],{{cite web | url=http://mssa.library.yale.edu/obituary_record/1925_1952/1942-43.pdf | title=Obituary Record Of Graduates Of Yale University Deceased During The Year, 1942-1943 | accessdate=March 25, 2011 | date=January 1, 1944 | publisher=Yale University}}{{rp|29}} attended [[Yale Law School]] and was admitted to the [[Delaware State Bar Association|Delaware Bar]] in 1893. After living in New York City for four years and working as assistant corporation counsel, he returned to his Delaware law practice in 1901. He married Elizabeth Bradford du Pont on October 4, 1908.{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Bayard - du Pont |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1908/10/04/104811105.pdf |quote=At Rencourt, near Greenville, to-day, Miss Elizabeth B. Du Pont, daughter of Alexis Irene Du Pont and the late Dr. Alexis I. Du Pont, was married to Thomas F. Bayard, son of the late Ambassador Bayard. ... |newspaper=[[New York Times]] |date=October 4, 1908 |accessdate=2012-11-28 }} He served as a chairman of the Delaware Democratic Party's state committee from 1906 to 1916, and as solicitor for the city of Wilmington from 1917 until 1919. ==Professional and political career== Bayard was elected to the U.S. Senate in a special election on November 7, 1922, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of U.S. Senator [[Josiah O. Wolcott]]. On the same day, he was also elected for the full term to follow, in both instances defeating incumbent Republican U.S. Senator [[T. Coleman du Pont]] (a cousin of Bayard's wife), who had been appointed. During this term, he served in the Democratic minority in the last session of the 67th Congress, and in the 68th, 69th, and 70th Congress. Bayard lost his bid for a second full term in 1928 to Republican [[John G. Townsend Jr.]], the former governor. He then lost another bid for a second full term in 1930 to incumbent Republican U.S. Senator [[Daniel O. Hastings]]. In all, Bayard served one term and part of another, from November 7, 1922, to March 3, 1929, during the administrations of U.S. presidents [[Warren G. Harding]] and [[Calvin Coolidge]]. Subsequently, he resumed his law practice in Wilmington. ==Death and legacy== Bayard died at Wilmington and is buried there in the [[Old Swedes Episcopal Church Cemetery]]. His son, [[Alexis I. du Pont Bayard]], served as Lieutenant Governor of Delaware from 1949 to 1953. He is the namesake of the town of [[Bayard, West Virginia]].{{cite book|last=Kenny|first=Hamill|title=West Virginia Place Names: Their Origin and Meaning, Including the Nomenclature of the Streams and Mountains|url=http://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015009099824;view=1up;seq=126|year=1945|publisher=The Place Name Press|location=Piedmont, WV|page=98}} ==References==
